loans.name: Angie Grace

texts.es:
La señora Angie Grace, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Victoria”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 18 años y 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.
Angie Grace, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en el Mercado “La Paradita” y lleva 01 año en el negocio, cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 7:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angie Grace belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Victoria,” in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. Angie Grace lives with her partner; she is 18 years old and has one child who depends on her financially.

Angie Grace decided to sell prepared food in the “La Paradita” market and has 1 year in her job and her stall is very well set up to take care of her customers. She tells us that she has a good daily income because of the delicious flavor that her food has. Most of her customers live in the city, are passersby, or are steady clients that know her and she is very well accepted by her clients.

To this day she still has the same job and is very happy with her job that she does everyday. She sells in the mornings from 7:00 am to 2:00 pm. She personally takes care of her customers with the charm that she is characterized by.

With this loan of S/. 500.00, she will buy products to prepare the daily food that she sells like: rice in kilograms, sugar, oil in gallons, potato sacks, live chickens, vegetables and some utensils to give her customers better care.

She has the motivation to get ahead as she has many dreams and goals in her life like having her own grocery store that would be well stoked. At the same time, she wishes to express her gratitude to Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) who contributed to the start of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare the food to be sold.

loans.name: Maria Inocenta

texts.es:
La señora María Inocenta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Victoria”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 46 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.

María Inocenta, se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios y se inició con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 y por iniciativa propia, implemento su pequeño negocio, en el Mercado “La Paradita”, donde atiende a sus clientes día a día. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, donde vende sus comidas preparadas como juanes, tamalitos, arroz chaufa, arroz con pollo; dulces y golosinas; chifles, y en bebidas como: gaseosas, refrescos y jugos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de refrigerios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Inocenta, belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Victoria,” district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. María Inocenta lives with her partner and she is 46 years old and has 4 children one who depends on her financially.

María Inocenta sells refreshments and began her job with her first loan of S/. 300.00. By her own initiative, she began her first small business in the “La Paradita” market where she takes care of her customers daily. To this day, she still has the same business and sells prepared food like juanes (a dish made of rice with chicken, olives, and eggs wrapped in a leaf), tamalitos (little tamales), arroz chaufa (rice dish with chicken, bacon and ham), chicken and rice, candy, chifles (fried banana chips), and drinks like refreshments, sodas and juice.

With this loan of S/ 500.00, she will buy products to prepare the food like: sacks of rice and sugar, chickens and eggs in crates, spaghetti, oil in bulk, as well as kitchen utensils to provide better service.

She feels motivated to keep selling refreshments. She is thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) for contributing to her fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to prepare food.

loans.name: Dalmith

texts.es:
La señora Dalmith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Victoria”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 26 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Dalmith, es una mujer joven y trabajadora, que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas y sueños, hace varios años, que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Y con su primer préstamo que Manuela Ramos, le brindo; implemento mucho más su negocio, ubicada en el Mercado “La Paradita”, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado. Hoy en la actualidad ya cuenta con  mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Dalmith, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dalmith belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Victoria,” district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. She is single is 26 years old and has a son who still depends on her financially.

Dalmith is a young woman who is hard-working and feels capable of realizing her goals and dreams. Several years ago she began selling groceries with her first loan from Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner)

To this day she has a loyal customer base who visits her store daily to buy her products as she has all the things that a housewife could need and she personally attends to her customers with the appeal that characterizes her.

With the loan of S/. 500.00, she will buy rice and sugar in sacks, spaghetti in packs, milk and canned fish boxes in a variety of brands, cleaning utensils for the home and personal hygiene products to keep giving better service to her customers.

Dalmith to this day feels very content with the desire to keep getting ahead and making her dreams a reality. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and to many women who wish to grow in their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase her products.

loans.name: Cindy Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Cindy Vanessa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Victoria”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 24 años y 01 hijo, 01 que está bajo su responsabilidad.

Cindy Vanessa, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en el Mercado “La Paradita” y lleva 05 años en el negocio, cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 6:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en el cumplimiento de sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cindy Vanessa belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Victoria,” district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. She is single and is 24 years old with a son who is under her responsibility.

Cindy Vanessa decided to sell prepared food in the “La Paradita” market and has 5 years in the business and she has very well set up surroundings to tend to her customers. She tells us that she has a good daily income because of the delicious flavor that her food has. Most of her customers live in the city, or are passersby and she has steady clients that know her and she is very well accepted by her clients.

To this day she continues to have the same business and is very happy with the work that she carries on daily. She sells from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm and personally watches over her clients with the charm that typifies her.

With this loan of S/. 500.00, she will buy the products that she needs to prepare the food like: rice in kilograms, sugar, oil in gallons, potato sacks, live chickens, vegetables and some utensils to use in her business and to give her customers better treatment.

She has the motivation to get ahead as she has many dreams and goals in her life like having her own grocery store that would be well stoked. At the same time, she wishes to express her gratitude to Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) who contributed to the start of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and other items.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Victoria”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 61 años y es madre de 01 hijo,  que aun depende de ella.

Andrea, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en el Mercado “La Paradita” y lleva 14 años en el negocio, cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. A diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 7:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea is a client of the "Mujeres de Victoria" Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, in San Martín Department (State). She is single, 61 years old, and mother of one son who is still a dependent.

14 years ago, Andrea decided to sell prepared foods in the "La Paradita" market. She counts on the very comfortable environment to see to her customers' needs. Her daily business is good, due to the rich flavor she gives her dishes. Her main customers are residents of the city, passersby and regular customers who already know her and know they will be well served.

She is continuing with the same business and is very satisfied with her day to day work. She sells in the mornings from 7:00 am until 2:00 pm and personally attends her customers with her characteristic charm.

With this loan of S/. 500 she will purchase supplies for daily preparation such as rice, sugar, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, cases of chickens and vegetables as well as utensils to carry out her business and provide better service to her customers.

She wants to get yet further ahead, and has many dreams and goals in her life such as opening up her own grocery store. At the same time, she gives thanks to the Movimento Manuela Ramos credit association for helping her to meet her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Progresivas II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años; 06 hijos que ya son independientes. 

Lucia, mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, por iniciativa propia, decidió acondicionar algunos ambientes de su casa, para el alquiler mensual de habitaciones, la cual el servicio los brinda a estudiantes y conocidos que llegan de otros lugares para quedarse a trabajar en el Distrito de Tarapoto. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y cuenta con 05 habitaciones. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,400.00, comprará ladrillos, cementos, triplay, para la construcción de mas habitaciones. Parte del dinero, también lo invertirá en la compra de accesorios, para los baños, para mejorar el servicio e higiene,  de esa mañera sus inquilinos queden   satisfechos y contentos.

Lucia, se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Lucia is part of the "Progressive Women II" Community Bank (Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department). She is married, is 42 years old, and has 6 grown children. Lucia is a hard-working woman and, on her own initiative, decided to equip a few rooms in her house to rent out by the month to students and acquaintances that are have come to stay and work in the Tarapoto district. At the moment, she is running the business and has 5 rooms. With the $500 loan she will buy bricks, cement, and wood for the construction of more rooms. She will also use some of the money to purchase furnishings and accessories for the bathrooms to improve the service and hygiene so that her tenants are satisfied and happy. Lucia feels very fulfilled and wants to make more of her dreams a reality. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to start her business and to many women who also want grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Construction Materials

loans.name: Clarita

texts.es:
La señora Clarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Progresivas II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 48 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Clarita, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Clarita, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Clarita is part of the "Progressive Women II" Community Bank (Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department). She lives with her partner, is 48 years old, and has 4 children- two of whom are still her dependents. Clarita is hardworking and a fighter and decided to start her own business and sell sodas from her home. She administrates her own business, and does not have a schedule nor boss. When she began she had S/. 300.00 and could buy only 5 packets of soda but when she saw that sales were going well she began to purchase a bit more. She currently runs the same business and is now well known by her customers who are her neighbors, relatives, and friends. With the $350 she will buy more beverages like: sodas in different flavors, sizes, and brands as well as sparkling and still mineral water. Clarita has many goals ahead of her and feels motivated to make her dreams a reality. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her payments and intends to keep it that way.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Soda Packets

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador G. is from Cabaruan, Cauayan City.  He is 48 years old, married and has three adult-aged children.  To make a living, he owns and operates a motorcycle transport business.  Dominador has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately Php200 net income daily.

In 2008, Dominador joined ASKI to access financial services, improve his living situation and engage in business.  Dominador is requesting a new loan of Php13,000 to repair and maintain his motorcycle. This loan will be his third from ASKI. 
---------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Repair and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen V., 55, is from the city of Mabini Street, Cauayan City.  She  is married and has two adult-aged children.  To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling shoe products in her local community.  Carmen has been in business for over 31 years and earns approximately Php20,000 a month.

In 2009, Carmen joined ASKI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. She is requesting a new loan of Php20,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  This loan will be her third from ASKI.  Carmen plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 
---------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia P. is from the village of Marabulig, Cauayan City.  She is 50 years old, has three adult-aged children and is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Ofelia raises crops, mainly planting and harvesting rice.  Ofelia has been in business for over seven years and earns approximately Php100,000 every cropping season.

In 2008, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  Ofelia is requesting a new loan of Php50,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  This loan will be her fifth from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 
------------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase aseeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia T. is from the village of Cabisera.  She is 56 years old and married. To make a living, Constancia raises crops; mainly planting and harvesting rice.

In 2009, Constancia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Constancia from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family. 
----------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ablawa Eugénie

texts.fr: A. Ablawa Eugénie est née le 30 Mars 1948 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin.  C’est une veuve ayant à sa charge trois enfants dont deux sont ses propres enfants et sont tous scolarisés. Ablawa Eugénie vit seule avec ses enfants au quartier Cocotomey non loin de Cotonou, depuis trois ans. Ablawa Eugénie supporte seule les charges de la famille. Ablawa Eugénie a très tôt arrêté l’école, et il y a deux ans, elle mène comme activité la vente de fuits et aussi de charbons de bois en détail à Cocotomey. Ablawa Eugénie s’approvisionne aux marchés de Glo et de Ouègbo, au Bénin. Ablawa Eugénie a déjà obtenu auprès de ALIdé, un crédit qui a été bien remboursé. C’est pour accroître son activité et ouvrir sa propre boutique afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Ablawa Eugénie sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Ablawa Eugénie was born on May 30, 1948 in Ouidah, a historic city of Benin. She is a widow with three children to support. Two of them are her own children, and all of them are in school. For three years, she has been living alone with her children in the Cocotomey district, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is the sole breadwinner of the family. Ablawa Eugénie stopped attending school early on. For two years, she has been running a business selling fruit and also charcoal at the retail level in Cocotomey. She supplies herself from the markets of Glo and Ouègbo, in Benin. She had an Alidé loan before, which has been repaid. To grow her business and to open her own shop, so as to satisfy her customers further, she's requesting a second Alidé loan.

Translated from French by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit (3 baskets of pineapples, 2 truck-loads of oranges) and 10 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario P. is from the village of San Fermin, Cauayan City. He is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. He owns and operates a food stall.  While not his only means of generating revenue, his main source of income comes from tending a canteen near a school.  Apolinario has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Apolinario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell in his restaurant business.  This loan will be his fourth from ASKI.  Apolinario plans to use the profits to improve and expand his business. 
-----------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: 02.06.1.4 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
"Phụng  N. Thị is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Phụng is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.06.1.4 Nam Ngạn.

Phụng  is married and has 2 adult-aged children.  To making a living, Phụng operates a family member's repair service business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members.  Phụng  has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Phụng  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Phụng  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Phụng  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị Lan (20) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.
2.  Lê Thị Dần  (21) is a 47 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.
3.  P. Thị Thu (22) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.
4.  T. Thị Phượng (23) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.
5.  N. Thị An (24) is a 24 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Phụng  N. Thị (19) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Phụng  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.06.1.4 Nam Ngạn (02.06.1.4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ sửa chữa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Phụng  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Phụng  kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Phụng  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Phụng  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần thiết để cung cấp dịch vụ.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Ngô Thị Lan (20) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.
2.  Lê Thị Dần  (21) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.
3.  P. Thị Thu (22) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.
4.  T. Thị Phượng (23) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.
5.  N. Thị An (24) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando S. is from the town of Ilagan. He is 34 years old, married and has two school-aged children.  Orlando owns and operates a business raising crops, mainly planting and harvesting rice.

In 2007, Orlando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Orlando has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Orlando is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more seeds, seedlings and young crops.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated to support his family. 
---------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna B. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has five school-age children. They are from the town of Ilagan. Myrna earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month.

In 2008, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Chagnaadorj

texts.en:
Chagchaadorj Juder is 53 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The oldest daughter of the five children is 17 years old and goes to Gurvan-Erdene University in the city and the other four children are high school students. Chagnaadorj's family moved to the capital city from Arhangai province 6 years ago, in search of a better life for his family and better business for himself. He owns a small old car that he uses as a taxi in the city. He also makes horse saddles from wood. He learned how to make horse saddle from his dad and his children help him in making various size saddles. His wife sells the saddle at the local market. He has been making saddles since 2003 and today it has grown into a family business in which almost all family members contribute in one way or another. He says that he would like to make his family business bigger and secure his children's future. He requests a loan to purchase saddle wood and other necessary materials for his saddle-making business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase saddle wood and other necessary materials

loans.name: Usuhbayar

texts.en: Usuhbayar Batjinnyam is 25-year-old and lives with his wife in Uvs Province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. He sells men's and women's clothing. In a few months, his wife will give birth to their first child. Usuhbayar is excited and, at the same time, would like to prepare for more family expenses in the near future. He is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to add to his business inventory. Usuhbayar worked as a clothing salesman at the local market. He worked at his brother's stall where he used to sell men's and women's clothing. After a few years of experience in retail clothing sales, he decided to launch his own business. Now, he rents a small stall at the market and sells women and men clothing. He buys the clothing in Ereen, China, a border town where many of cheap Chinese products are exported to Mongola. loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en:
Yanjmaa S. is 57 years old and single. All her children have already grown up and live with their own families. She had worked for the local police office as a cook for more than twenty years and retired in 2005. As soon as her retirement started, she launched her small business and opened up her own fast food place. She runs her food place every season except for winter. During the winter when her other business is closed she sells cooking oil to locals. She mostly purchases cooking oil from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. This is her third winter selling cooking oil and she has already got some loyal customers who like to do business with her. She says that she would like to carry on her business with help of her children. She requests a loan to purchase more cooking oil for her business. 


About XacBank

loans.name: 18.01.016 Group

texts.en:
Tân N. Thị (8) is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW). While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 016-Quảng Hưng (18.01.016).
Tân is married and has two adult -aged children. To making a living, she owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Tân has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.
In 2004, Tân joined FPW to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from FPW. This loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will also be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. The loan will be her ninth from FPW. Tân plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement her family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group
1. N. Thị Mai (3) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business. 2. N. Thị Cúc (6) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 3. N. Thị Tuyển (2) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. 4. Lê Thị T. (5) is a 57-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW)
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.
