loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Mrs. Vong P., 41 years old, is a married woman living with other family members in her home. She takes care of four children, most of whom are employed in the garment industry.

Vong currently relies on the income from her husband’s trade. He works as a local ox-trader who also buys oxen in bulk to fatten for a few weeks and then sell at a profit.

Traveling to buy oxen is very hard, because he doesn’t own a vehicle. Therefore, Vong has requested a loan for her husband to buy a motorcycle, which he will use to support his business.

Vong was not available for a photograph, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle, which will support her husband's business

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy sells men's clothes and shoes. This is the high season for his business and he hopes to make more profit. He is 39 years old and married with one child. His wife sells groceries to help support the home.

With his business, Timothy hopes to meet the basic needs of his family. He has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting a loan of 150,000 NGN to purchase more clothes to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Iqbol's Group

texts.en:
Iqbol, the leader of this group, comes from the rural town of Kant. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, most of the industrial factories stopped working, and there was little opportunity to work for the government. Alert people switched to commerce. They started to trade in various goods or opened their own businesses. Lots of people have gone abroad in search of work. Iqbol has been lucky, since she and her husband stayed in the city. They have been able to make their living in Kant.

Her husband is a builder. They are raising five children. The eldest daughter is thirteen, and the smallest son is just a year and half. Iqbol inherited a trade from her parents, making flat cakes. She invested $23 and started selling flat cakes at home. It has been six years since she started, and now she has a net profit of $95 a month.

Iqbol’s elder daughter helps her look after the little kids and also helps her knead dough. Her husband helps her buy and transport flour. Sometimes her children stay outside with Iqbol and help her sell the flat cakes.

Currently, Iqbol needs a loan to purchase three sacks of flour, salt and yeast for baking flat cakes. She has big plans for expanding her business and helping her children get an education and get on their feet. Iqbol’s group partners: Zebiniso, 38, is a builder’s wife. She has six children. Zebiniso and her husband have recently collected beet crops. They also keep hens and sell eggs. They need a loan to buy a cow, so that they do not have to buy milk for their children. Mukimjon, 48, trades in vegetables: potatoes, beets and radishes. He has three children. Mukimjon hopes to provide them with a good education and wants his daughters to marry. Mukimjon needs a loan to invest in purchasing vegetables wholesale. Salomat, 43, has four children. Her husband works as a builder. Salomat bakes and sells flat cakes. She hopes to obtain a loan to buy several sacks of flour. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for flat cakes

loans.name: Synzhibek's Group

texts.ru:
Чортонова Сынжибек – лидер данной группы. Сынжибек тридцать семь лет. Муж Сынжибек работает кочегаром в школе. В течение многих лет Сынжибек вместе с мужем копили деньги, чтобы приобрести хоть какую – то живность. Наконец-то их труды увенчались успехом, и они приобрели первую корову. Так как муж Сынжибек находился постоянно в школе, основные обязанности по ухаживанию за коровой легли на плечи Сынжибек. Она быстро привыкла к новому занятию и вскоре даже начала проявлять желание на счёт приобретения бычков. Она пришла к выводу, что в нынешних условиях заниматься животноводством – выгодное дело. Муж помог с новым вложением, к тому же у них появился дополнительный доход от продажи молока. И вот уже пятнадцать лет Сынжибек вместе с мужем занимаются животноводством. Они покупают бычков, откармливают их в течение года и перепродают. Теперь Сынжибек получает удовольствие от своего занятия. Ведь за пятнадцать лет, животноводство являлось источником мяса, молока и источником значительных средств при продаже скота или мяса. Также Сынжибек и её мужу удалось построить дом. Одна только продажа молока приносит им ежемесячно две тысячи четыреста сомов. Хотя, когда Сынжибек свою первую корову купила всего лишь за две тысячи сомов. Теперь Сынжибек намеревается купить телёнка для откорма и продажи. Но у Сынжибек нет наличных средств, чтобы осуществить покупку. Поэтому она и обратилась за кредитом. 

У Сынжибек три партнёра по группе:

Осмоновой Эркингуль тридцать семь лет. Она – мать двоих детей. Муж Эркингуль занимается стройкой. Сама же Эркингуль разводит скот, занимается его перепродажей, а также продажей молока. Эркингуль нужен кредит, чтобы купить телёнка.

Джузумалиевой Салтанат сорок восемь лет. У Салтанат трое детей. Супруг Салтанат – медик, работает в больнице. Салтанат дома держит скот и продаёт молоко. Салтанат надеется купить бычка. Для этого ей нужен кредит. 

Саткеевой Анаре пятьдесят лет. У Анары двое детей. Оба уже взрослые: дочь замужем и живёт со своей семьёй. Сын живёт вместе с родителями. Муж Анары – разнорабочий на стройке. Сама Анара развозит груз. Анара хочет получить кредит и купить корову. 


 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Synzhibek C. is a leader of this group. Synzhibek is thirty seven years old. Her husband works as steam engine fireman at a school. During many years Synzhibek together with her husband have been saving money so they could buy some kind of livestock. Finally, their labor efforts have been successful and they have bought their first cow. Because Synzhibek's husband is always at the school and main responsibilities for taking care of the cow have been placed on Synzhibek's shoulders. She got used to the new business quickly and soon started to show interest in getting a calf. She has concluded that in today's circumstances animal husbandry is a profitable business. Her husband helped with the new investment and they also started to get additional income from milk sales. It has been fifteen years as Synzhibek and her husband have been doing animal husbandry. They buy calves, feed them for one year and then resell. Right now Synzhibek enjoys doing her business. During these fifteen years animal husbandry has been a source of meat, milk and a substantial income from the sales of cattle and meat. Synzhibek and her husband were able to build a house. Just the milk sales alone bring them 2,400 somoni a month. Synzhibek has bought her first cow for only 2,000 somoni. Right now she is planning to buy a calf for feeding and resale, but she does not have the finances to realize her purchase. This is why she has asked for a loan. Synzhibek has three group partners: Erkingul O. is thirty three years old. She is a mother of two children. Erkingul's husband works in construction. Erkingul breeds the cattle herself and also resells it as well as sells the milk. Erkingul needs a loan to buy a calf. Saltanat D. is forty eight years old. She has three children. Saltanat's husband is a medical worker in a hospital. Saltanat keeps the cattle at home and sells the milk. She hopes to buy a calf and she needs a loan for this. Anara S. is fifty years old. Anara has two children. They are both grown ups: her daughter is married and lives with her family. Her son lives with the parents. Anara's husband does miscellaneous work in construction. Anara transports freights. She wants to get a loan to buy a cow.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calves for resale

loans.name: Chizoba

texts.en: Chizoba has a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers, and she also sells hair extensions and creams. She is 37 years old and married with a child. Her husband is a police officer. She has been in this business for a long time. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Silifatu

texts.en:
Silifatu is 52 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband is a driver.

Silifatu sells roots and native medicine call Agbo. “I love my business, and I love seeing people healthy,” says Silifatu. She is requesting the loan of N50,000. She will use this loan to invest in the business of selling roots (Agbo) which she will buy in bulk to get a better price. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more roots for preparing Agbo

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun P. is a 57-year-old farmer living in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. A widowed mother of four children, all married and employed, Chhun P. is requesting a loan to order a large quantity of mature rice from farmers during the time when rice is commanding the cheapest price. She hopes to later sell her rice for a profit when the price rises.

loans.use: To order a large quantity of mature rice

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi sells women's and children's shoes at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a shoe factory in the future. She is a friendly and hardworking woman that is determined to lift her family above poverty. She is 40 years old and married with four children. Her husband is an electrician and he also supports the home. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more shoes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle is 42 years old and married with six children. He sells video CDs. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. His wife sells clothes and they both contribute to meet the needs of the family. He puts in long hours trying to keep his businesses sustainable. One of his greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction he is able to have with his customers. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more video cassettes to sell. He say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more video cassettes to sell

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en: Alimatu, a 40 years old mother of four children, is married to a mechanic who helps support the home. They live in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria, where Alimatu sells medicines at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a maternity home in the future. A hard-working woman who aspires to lift her business and family above poverty, Alimatu is requesting a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Amintu

texts.en:
Amintu is very hardworking and she makes sure she has food on the table every day through her hard work. She is 42 years old and is married with five children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria and assists her husband with the family expenses.

Amintu prepares and sells a native medicine call Agbo and also sells food spices and roots for preparing Agbo. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more roots for preparing Agbo. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more roots for preparing of Agbo to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
To earn a living, Janet sells sarongs of various colors and shapes. She has been in this business for four years and hopes to expand her business in future by owning a boutique.

Janet is 32 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband works with the government.

This is the festive season for sales and Janet hopes to make more profits. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 35 years old and is married with four children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Samson makes and sells cellophane (a thin, transparent sheet used for food packaging), a business that is now booming. With the loan of N50,000 he plans to expand his cellophane business by buying more material for the production of cellophane.

With this kind of business Samson hopes to increase his earnings in the long run and be able to better provide for his children's education. He says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more material for the production of cellophane

loans.name: Oyeteju

texts.en: Oyeteju has a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers and also sells hair extensions and cream. This is the festive season and the demands for her goods and services will be high, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Oyeteju is 37 years old, married with two children, and has been in business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. Oyeteju  thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo, 45 years old and married with four children, sells sarongs in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria, where she resides. She is requesting a loan  of N50,000 to purchase a variety of sarongs that will significantly expand her clothing trade. Fumilayo believes that having an assortment of sarongs of both practical and good quality will increase her sales. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Adejoke

texts.en: Adejoke is not a tailor but has been selling tailoring materials including zip, landings, and thread for the past six years. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction  she has with her customers. Adejoke is 35 years old, the mother of two children, and married to a civil servant. Now requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials to sell, she says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en:
Abiodun is very hard-working and she makes sure she has food on the table every day through her hard work. She is 33 years old, married with 3 children. She sells drinks and groceries like milk, sugar, tomato paste, soap, etc. and has a plan to expand the business by adding the sale of other foodstuffs. She says there is high demand for foodstuffs at this season.

With this thought in mind, she is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Ololade

texts.en:
Ololade sells medicines at retail prices to earn a living. She hopes to be a medicine distributor in her community in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. Nigeria is located in West Africa and it is a country that is blessed with natural resources.

Ololade is 28 years old, married with 2 children. Her husband is a mechanic and he also supports the household. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Cheri Mai

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheri Mai M. lives in a nuclear family in Thecho with her husband, son, and daughter. Thecho is located in the Lalitpur District. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Cheri's husband, Mr. Hari Gopal M., is a farmer. He works his own land. Both her son and daughter are at university.

Mrs. M. opened up her own tailoring shop 3 year ago. She prefers to make custom-fitted ladies' clothes like "kurta-salwar", blouses and other varieties of ladies' dresses in her shop. She took tailoring training from a local tailoring shop. Now she is asking for her third loan from Kiva of Rs 30,000 to buy raw materials such as cloth, thread, etc. for her tailoring work. She repaid her first Kiva loan in Oct 08.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Tolulope

texts.en: Tolulope, a 45-year-old married mother of two children, sells foodstuffs and food spices at retail prices to her customers. With these combined businesses, which she has operated for a long time, Tolulope hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members.  She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Mrs. Parbati G., 34, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur District, Nepal. She is one of the active group members of Patan Business and Professional Women. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, her husband, two daughters, and a son. Her husband, Mr. Shankar G., is a farmer and works their own field. Their daughters are studying in grades 10 and 6 and their son is in grade 4. Because Mr. G. is the eldest son of his father, Nepali culture requires that his father live with them.

Mrs. G. opened her grocery shop 6 years ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her store such as rice, maize, and noodles. Her children help her in her shop. She is requesting a third loan from Kiva of NPR 30000 to buy more varied inventory for her shop. She paid her last loan in Oct 2009.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Suleman

texts.en: Suleman, 60 years old and married with four children, sells foodstuffs in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria, where he lives. He is excited to request a Kiva loan and will use it to purchase foodstuffs in bulk at a better price. Suleman hopes that this loan will help make the business more profitable and provide benefits for his children. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Olufunmilayo

texts.en: Fifty-six year old Olufunmilayo, the wife of a fashion designer and the mother of five children, sells bags of rice at wholesale prices to her customers.  Since this is the high season for her business, she hopes to make greater profits, her goal being to lift her family above poverty.  Olufunmilayo has been in this business for a long time and is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more bags of rice to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. Thecho is among the under-developed villages of Nepal, and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural pursuits.

Mrs. M. lives with her husband and one son. Her son is in pre-primary school. Both Mrs. M. and her husband, Mr. Shyam M., are engaged in making brass religious statues. They makes statues according to the orders of their customers.

Now Mrs. M. is requesting a Rs 20,000 loan to buy raw materials for making brass religious statues.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad, a 30-year-old married man with six children, has been working as a taxi driver since 2005 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of his family. Today, Ziad is asking for a loan of $1,000 to perform maintenance on his car after encountering bad circumstances.

loans.use: To perform maintenance for his car

loans.name: Adeoye

texts.en: Adeoye, 45 years old and married with three children, is a focused, hard-working man who puts in long hours trying to keep his engine oil-selling business sustainable. One of his greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction he is able to have with his customers. Residing in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria, he and his wife, who sells pepper, both contribute to supporting the family.  Adeoye wishes to increase his stock and so is requesting a loan of N70,000.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more engine to sell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 19-year-old single man living with his parents and three brothers. He has been working as an electrician since 2006 to earn income to satisfy, in collaboration with his father and brothers, the needs of the family.

Today, Hussein is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy a car that will facilitate his business movements and enable him to be available upon his clients’ request.

loans.use: To buy a car for his business

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 28-year-old married man living with his wife and four children. When he turned 18 he bought a small van to make a living by transporting goods. His business flourished and after a while he purchased a larger van to be able to accommodate the demand.

Today, Abbas is requesting $1,100 in order to fix his van and perform needed maintenance.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his van

loans.name: Rezek

texts.en:
Rezek is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and three young children. He first learned agriculture fifteen years ago when he started working in this sector . In 2000, he started working on his own as a farmer and he is excelling in the business.

Today, Rezek is requesting $1,200 in order to purchase agriculture equipment needed in order to enlarge his business and make more dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en:
Bolanle is 35 years old and is married with three children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Bolanle sells clothing and is planning to purchase a variety of clothing that will significantly expand his clothing trade. He believes that having an assortment of clothes of good quality will increase his sales.

Bolanle is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more clothing to sell. He say thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Joram's Group

texts.en: Joram K. is a hard-working man and the leader of his lending group in Rukungiri. Married with one child aged six years who is in nursery school, Joram is a carpenter with a carpentry business in Buyanja's trading centre that he has owned for a long time. Joram started his business very small but now has a workshop, enabling him to make 200,000/= in profits a month.   His dreams are to acquire electrical machines for his work and to enable his children to become educated for a brighter future. Joram is requesting a loan to buy carpentry materials such as timber, varnish, and wood for improved services.

loans.use: Buying timber, varnish and wood for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 35-year-old married man with four children who still go to school. He has owned a car repair shop in his town since 2000.

Today, Mohamad is asking for a loan of $1,100 to buy new tools and a specific machine to develop his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new tools and a specific machine

loans.name: Moji

texts.en:
Moji is 51 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Moji sells different kinds of wine, juice and table water. With the increased demand for drinks, she plans to expand her business by increasing her stock. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more wine and juice to sell.

Moji says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wine and juice to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PLATEAU2 depuis deux ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires et de toilette, de tissu, de chaussures et de sacs à main pour dame. Avec ses bénéfices elle parvient à s'équiper en matériel électrogène avec l'achat d'un réfrigérateur à 200.000 francs CFA. Elle participe également à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of 4 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of PLATEAU2 for two and a half years and has received 5 loans which she has repaid without issue. She is developing a small business of clothing, washing, fabric, shoes, and handbags for women. With the profits, she intends to equip herself with electric generator equipment with the purchase of a 200,000 FCFA refrigerator. They will also serve to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promotion of Commercial Business

loans.name: Mosood

texts.en:
Mosood sells bags of beans to make a living in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is 50 years old and is married with three children. His wife is a fashion designer and she also supports the home.

Mosood has been in his business for a long time. The demand for his bags of beans is high in his community so he is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bags of beans to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 37 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Esther sells secondhand clothes. She is a focused, hard worker and puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. She plans to rent a store in future.

Esther is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 28-year-old married woman with one child. In 2007, after ten years of experience and after having her first child, she decided to work as a home-based tailor to help her husband with the household expenses.

Today, Zeina is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine in order to present a variety of products to her clientele.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jadesola

texts.en:
Jadesola sells bags of pure water at retail prices to her customers. She is also a tailor and she makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. She has been in business for four years. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits.

Jadesola is 45 years old and is married with a child. With her combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. 

Jadesola is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more bags of pure water to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pure water to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 50 years old and is married with five children. She sells crates of drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Esther is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Chijoke

texts.en:
Chijoke sells building materials to make a living in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is 32 years old and is single without children. He hopes to get married very soon.

Chijoke has been in this business for eight years. He is a hardworking man and he hopes to expand his business in future. He is requesting a loan of 170,000 NGN to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Monsurat

texts.en: Monsurat sells slippers at retail prices to her customers. She is so happy in her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is a focused, hard worker. She is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more slippers to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Kayode

texts.en:
Kayode is 45 years old and is married with four children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. His wife is a fashion designer.

Kayode sells video cassettes and is able to support his family's basic needs and other necessities. With the loan of N50,000 he plans to expand his video cassette business, which is now booming. With this kind of business he hopes to increase his earnings in the long run and be able to better provide for his children's education.

Kayode says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more video cassettes to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia ROSA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijas mujeres. La socia y sus hijas viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende productos de snack como: galletas, golosinas, helados y muchos más. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender mercadería como: golosinas, panetones, tortas, y helados para estas fiestas navideñas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the Llankachinapac Communal Bank. She is 38, in a common law marriage, and has two daughters. She and her daughters live in the Urubamba province, which is located north of the city of Cusco. She has a small store where she sells snack products like crackers, sweets, ice cream, and much more. She has been working in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who wants to get her children ahead. She needs a loan to buy and sell merchandise like sweets, “panetones” (an Italian sweet bread which is a Christmastime staple), cakes, and ice cream for the Christmas festivities. That way she will be able to increase her business capital, have better income, and give her children a better quality of life. She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her and promises to complete her payments on the respective due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell merchandise like sweets, “panetones” (an Italian sweet bread which is a Christmastime staple), cakes, and ice cream for the Christmas festivities

loans.name: Veleros Group

texts.es:
Venta de arena, verduras, ropa, papa, carne, tejido de prendas de vestir (chompas y mantas) confección de  carteras y servicio de amplificación son los diversos negocios de las integrantes del grupo Veleros que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal  Los Andes, se agruparon recientemente para acceder al préstamo porque necesitan incrementar mercadería en los casos de negocios de comercialización, materia prima en negocios de producción y activo fijo en el negocio de servicio.
Veleros son amigas y vecinas de una misma zona, desarrollan su reunión con la organización de su mesa directiva, así, Daría M. es la Presidenta, Maria V. es la Tesorera y la Secretaria de Actas es Zulma C., juntas elaboran el reglamento interno para trabajar en el presente ciclo.
texts.en:
The members of the Veleros group, which belongs to the Los Andes Community Center, have diverse businesses like selling sand, vegetables, clothes, potatoes, meat, weaving clothes (sweaters and blankets), making wallets, and providing amplification services. They recently got together to get access to the loan because the ones who have commercial businesses need to increase their merchandise. The ones who have production businesses need raw materials, and the ones with service businesses need hard assets. The Veleros are friends and neighbors from the same area. The meeting takes place with the organization of their board of directors. Daría M. is the president, Maria V. is the treasurer, and Zulma C. is the secretary. Together they make the internal rules to work in the present cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, raw materials, and fixed assets

loans.name: Fasiu

texts.en: Fasiu sells electrical materials at retail prices to his customers. He is 50 years old and married with 4 children. He has been in this business for a long time. He sells for long hours to enable him to put food on his table to feed his family members. He is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more electrical materials to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia MARITZA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos varones. La socia y sus hijos viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene una broasteria donde prepara platos como: pollipapas, salchipapas y pollo broaster. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para abrir una cabina de internet va implementarla comprando computadoras, monitores y accesorios,  así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maritza belongs to the Llankachinapac Communal Bank. She is 31, in a common law marriage, and has two sons. She and her sons live in the Urubamba province, which is located north of the city of Cusco. She has a restaurant where she makes dishes like “pollipapas” (typical dish made with fried sausage, potatoes, and chicken), “salchipapas” (typical dish made from fried sausage and potatoes), and roasted chicken. She has been working in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who wants to get her children ahead. She needs a loan to open an Internet cafe. She is going to equip it by purchasing computers, monitors, and accessories. That way she will be able to increase her business capital, have better income, and give her children a better quality of life. She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her and promises to complete her payments on the respective due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open an Internet cafe and equip it by purchasing computers, monitors, and accessories

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose sells clothing materials of various colors at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are within and outside Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She loves this business because of the profits that she makes from the business. She has been in business for a long time.

Rose is 38 years old and is married with four children. Her husband is also involved in her business.

Rose is requesting a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more clothing materials to sell. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is Memuna K.. She is a 35-year-old married woman from Wilberforce, an area within Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone. She has three children: one boy and two girls, all in secondary school. Her husband is a teacher.

Memuna has been in LAPOSL for some time now and has taken one previous loan as a member of a LAPOSL Union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving from Kiva lenders.

Memuna sells her goods from her house in Freetown. She sells drinks, palm oil, and bags of rice. She expanded the inventory of her stall with the first loan she collected and she also decided to buy the same type of goods with this new loan.

Memuna says she will pay her children's school fees with the profit from this new loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for sale

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth sells clothing materials of various colors at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are within and outside Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She loves this business because of the profits that she makes from the business. She has been in business for six years.

Janeth is 29 years old and is married with a child. Her husband is also involved in her business.

Janeth is requesting a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more clothing materials to sell. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is  Isatu B., a 23-year-old single woman from Wilberforce, an area within Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone. Isatu has one child, a girl, a year old.

Isatu has been a client of LAPOSL for some time now, and has taken out two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Isatu has a shop in Lumley market in Freetown from which she sells soap, toothpaste and creams. With her first two loans, she expanded the inventory of her shop and with her new loan, she decided to buy the same types of goods.

Isatu hopes her latest LAPOSL loan will allow her to move forward to an increased profit and a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of her shop

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
La socia LUCRECIA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos un varón y una mujer. La socia y sus hijos viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia se dedica a distribuir condimento molido a las vendedoras minorista del mercado de Ollantaytambo. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender  condimentos molidos como: pimienta, ajo, comino y ají, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lucrecia belongs to the Llankachinapac Communal Bank. She is 30, married, and has one son and a daughter. She and her children live in the Urubamba province, which is located north of the city of Cusco. She distributes ground condiments to the retail sellers in the Ollantaytambo market. She has been working in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who wants to get her children ahead. She needs a loan to buy and sell ground condiments like pepper, garlic, cumin, and chili peppers. That way she will be able to increase her business capital, have better income, and give her children a better quality of life. She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her and promises to complete her payments on the respective due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell ground condiments like pepper, garlic, cumin, and chili peppers

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus O. is a 35 year old man who is married to Lucy Nyambura. Together they have two daughters. Justus has been running a bookshop in Naivasha town for the last two years.

This is Justus’ second loan from KADET and he has never borrowed from any other financial institution before. He got to know about KADET through a marketing event done by KADET staff.

Justus intends to add more stock of books to his bookshop and this will enable him to make more sales and hence more income. 

His future dream is to convert his retail shop into a wholesale business.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To add stock of books in his bookshop

loans.name: Bonkie

texts.en:
This is Bonkie K., a 57-year-old widow from Wilberforce, an area within Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone. Bonkie has six children: three boys and three girls. Two of them are working and three are still in secondary school.

Bonkie has been a member of LAPOSL for some time and has taken one previous loan. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she is taking with the help of Kiva lenders.

Bonkie runs her business within Freetown. She sells bags of rice wholesale from her home, and her adult daughter sells bags from a stall in the market. With her first loan, Bonkie expanded her business by purchasing additional stocks of rice. With this new loan, she has decided to expand again in the same way.

With the extra profit she will make from the loan, Bonkie is sending her daughter to Guinea (a neighboring country) to purchase clothes, jewelry, and bags to sell in Freetown.

loans.use: To purchase additional bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson sells second-hand fridges and air-conditioners at retail prices to his customers. He is 49 years old and married with three children. His wife is a fashion designer and she also supports the home. 

He is a focused, hard worker. He has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more second-hand fridges and air-conditioners to sell .

He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand fridges and air-conditioners to sell

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia GLADIS pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 23 años de edad y tiene un hijo varón de dos años. La socia, su esposo Felipe y su hijo viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende celulares (teléfonos móviles). Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender más accesorios de celulares para estas fiestas navideñas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gladis belongs to the Llankachinapac communal bank. She is 23 years old and has a 2-year-old son. She lives with her husband Felipe and their son in the province of Urubamba, which is north of Cusco.

Gladis has a small store where she sells cell phones. She has been doing this for several years and it gone very well, thanks to the determination she has devoted to her work. Gladis is a hard-working and enterprising young mother who wants to help her children get ahead in life.

Gladis requires this loan to buy more cell phone accessories to sell during the Christmas season. This will increase her working capital, bring better income, and allow her to give her son a better quality of life.

Gladis is grateful for the opportunity provided by this loan, and commits to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cell phone accessories to sell during Christmas season

loans.name: Marlene De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Marlene Méndez de 38 años de edad, se dedica al a venta de cosméticos y prendas de plata lleva tres años en este negocio, lo hizo con la iniciativa de tener sus propios ingresos y poder ayudar a su esposo y sus dos hijos que cursan la primaria. Su esposo trabaja de ingeniero electrónico. Con este nuevo crédito invertirá en prendas de plata como oro laminado, cosméticos variados para llamar la atención a nuevos clientes, vende al contado y al crédito de la quincena, las dificultades que abecés no logra vender lo esperado, le pagan retrasado, y es cuando se desanima. Contenta ya que gracia al financiamiento puede lograr la inversión de inventario y poder mantener el equilibrio en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marlene Méndez is 38 years old and sells cosmetics and silver jewelry. She has been doing this for 3 years, ever since she took the initiative to have her own income and help her husband and her 2 children who are in primary school. Her husband works as an electronics engineer.

With this new loan she will invest in gold-laminated silver jewelry and various cosmetics to attract new customers. She sells for cash or on two-week credit. At times she doesn't sell as much as she expected, or the customers pay late, and its at these times that she becomes dispirited. Now she is content, since with this financing she will be able to invest in inventory and maintain the equilibrium of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY COSMETICS AND JEWELRY TO SELL

loans.name: Amarachi

texts.en:
Amarachi is 25 years old and married with a child. Her husband is also involved in this business. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. 

She sells curtains at wholesale and retail prices to her customers to earn a living. With this business, she hopes to meet the basic needs and necessities of her family members. She is requesting a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more curtains to sell.

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more curtains to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells curtains at retail prices to her customers to make a living. She is 38 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is also involved in this business. She sells for long hours to ensure that she is able to meet the basic needs of her family members. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more curtains to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more curtains to sell.

loans.name: Saka

texts.en:
Saka is 60 years old and married with two children. He sells sand.  He is requesting a loan amount of 60,000 NGN. He will use this loan to invest in his business of selling sand which he will buy in bulk to get a better price.

He say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sand to sell

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es:
El socio FELIPE pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

El socio tiene 23 años de edad y tiene un hijo varón de dos años. El socio, su esposa Gladis y su hijo viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestro socio tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende computadoras, suministros y mucho más. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestro socio es un joven, trabajador y emprendedor que quiere sacar adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender más suministros y accesorios de computadoras para estas fiestas navideñas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Felipe is a member of the communal bank "Llankachinapac." He is 23 years-old and has one two-year-old son. Felipe, his wife Gladis, and their son live in the province of Urubamba, located north of the city of Cuzco. Our member has a small store where he sells computers, supplies, and much more. He has already been in this business for a few years, and it has gone very well, thanks to all the effort he has invested in his work. Felipe is young, hard-working, and enterprising, and wants to get his family ahead. He needs this loan to purchase more computer accessories and supplies to sell during the Christmas season, which would allow him to increase his business capital and thus earn better profits. Then he could provide for his son a better quality of life. Our member is grateful for the opportunity offered through the institution, and promises to make all the payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs this loan to purchase and sell more computer accessories and supplies.

loans.name: Marcos Erminio

texts.es: Don Marcos Rodríguez es un hombre trabajador desde que salio del ejercito de Nicaragua le dieron una pensión el cual con este dinero monto su propio negocio desde hace quince años vendiendo lentes, relojes, lámparas de noche, alarmas entre otro en la cotran del Mayoreo en donde vende ambulante por que solicito un permiso para vender ambulante dentro de la misma. Ya que es donde salen todas las unidad de buses a los diferente departamento del norte. Gracias a los préstamo que Afodenic a  otorgado ha logrado mantener su inventario, por que las ventas en los últimos meses han sido baja a demás el tiene que comprar su almuerzo ya que desde horas temprana sale con su venta para poder lograr vender. Con este préstamo que es temporada navideña desea invertir en la compra de billetera, calculadoras, gorras, relojes para dama y caballero como una variedad de lentes para atraer clientes y lograr que sus ventas aumenten para poder sastifacer las necesidades de su esposa y sus dos hijos ya que de su fuente de trabajo subsisten.
texts.en:
Marcos is a hard-working man. When he left the Nicaraguan Army he received a pension and with this money he began his business, selling glasses, watches, night lights, alarm clocks, among other things, in Managua's Mayoreo market. He is a mobile vendor who has obtained permission to sell there. This is where all buses depart for the northern departments.

Thanks to loans provided through AFODENIC, he has been able to maintain his inventory, although in recent months his sales have been low. Since he must start selling very early if he wants to succeed, he has to buy his own lunch.

With this loan for Christmas season Marcos wants to buy billfolds, calculators, caps, and watches for ladies and gentlemen, as well as a variety of glasses, to attract customers, increase sales and satisfy the needs of his wife and his 2 children, who depend on his source of work.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY POCKET BOOKS, BILLFOLDS, CAPS, CALCULATORS AND GLASSES TO INCREASE BUSINESS

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 35 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband is a plumber and they both contribute to supporting the family.

Alice sells clothing and underwear. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase a variety of clothing and to expand her clothing trade. She believes that having an assortment of good quality clothing this festive period will increase her sales. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia VIRGINIA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 24 años de edad y tiene un hijo varón de tres años. La socia y su hijo viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene una pequeña tienda de sanck en el terminal terrestre de buses de la provincia de Urubamba donde vende golosinas, galletas, gaseosas y panes a los visitantes que están de paso por esta ciudad. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender más mercadería para estas fiestas navideñas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the communal bank "Llankachinapac." She is 24 years-old and has one three-year-old son. Our member and her son live in the province of Urubamba, located north of the city of Cuzco. Our member has a small snack store in the Urubamba province bus terminal, where she sells candies, cookies, soft drinks, and bread to visitors that pass through the city. She has been working in this business for a few years and it has gone very well, thanks to all the effort she has invested in her work. Virginia is a young mother, hard-working, and enterprising, and wants to get her family ahead. She needs this loan to purchase more merchandise to sell during the Christmas season, allowing her to increase her business capital and earn better profits, and thus be able to provide a better quality of life to her son. Our member is very grateful for the opportunity offered by this institution and promises to make all the payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member needs this loan to purchase more merchandise to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Marithza Isabel

texts.es: La joven Maritza González  trabaja de cajera  en un negocio de llantas  lleva nueve años trabajando, cuando inicio entro como conserje, luego comenzó a estudiar ya que sus deseos es superarse como toda mujer. Pero abecés por recurso económicos se nos hace difícil, lo bueno es que logro que la ascendieron de puesto. Tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el barrio tres ochenta junto con su esposo y un hijo de un año, su casa ya la hizo pero falta repellarla, hacer las divisiones de los cuartos para mejor privacidad, el piso ya que es de tierra y quiere embaldosar para mejor higiene de su hijo. Su meta es poder seguir estudiando para llegar a optar por un mejor puesto como mejores ingresos. Con este préstamo  lo quiere es hacer un porche para empezar como un corredor y poco a poco terminarlo el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento. Esta contenta por lograr hacer cada vez más bonita su casa todo esto gracias al apoyo del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Young Marithza González works as a cashier in a tire business. She has worked there for nine years. She started there as a janitor, then began to go to school. However, studying was difficult due to her economic situation and the best she could achieve was a promotion at her job.

Marithza is 26 years old and lives in neighborhood 380 with her husband and one-year-old son. Their house is livable, but lacks plaster, and interior walls for privacy. The floor is dirt and they would like to cover it with tiles for the hygiene of the baby.

Her goal is to continue her studies to be able to choose a better job with better pay. With this loan, she will build a porch that will begin as a corridor and be finished little by little. The loan will pay for construction materials like stone, sand and cement. Marithza is happy to be able to make her house prettier each time with the help of this financing.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stone, cement, sand, steel, and roofing for corridor to be finished later

loans.name: Feyisara

texts.en:
Feyisara is 54 years old and married with four children. Her youngest child is 18 years old. Her husband is a lawyer in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. 

She sells crates of drinks at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. Her greatest joy in her business is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. 

She is requesting a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en:
Bolanle is 55 years old and married with three children. Her eldest child is 30 years old. Her husband is a printer. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. 

She is a friendly woman and she uses her people skills to attract more customers to her stall. She sells crates of drinks at wholesale prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. 

She says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Doña Melania C. mujer trabajadora, tiene una panadería  que junto con su esposo lograron poner hace muchos años el cual distribuyen a las diferentes  panaderías de la capital de Managua. La señora Melania tiene 44 años, procreo cuatro hijos dos trabajan y dos estudian, cuando inicio comenzó con venta de la Avon vendiendo ambulante y por encargo con los catálogos. Las dificultades es que algunos clientes no le pagaban y se descapitalizaba, es por eso comienza con su esposo a trabajar e invertir todo en la panaderia.  Con este préstamo comprara saco de harina para hacer el pan y que no le falte inventario a demás azúcar, manteca, canela, queso entre otros. Con el fin de incrementar las ventas y variedad del productos. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de apoyar al pequeño comerciante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Melania C., a hard-working woman, has a bakery which she was able to open many years ago with her husband. From here they distribute to the various bakeries in the capital Managua. Melania is 44 years old and is the mother of four children, two of them are working and two are students. When she started she sold Avon as a street vendor and by mail order through catalogs. The trouble was that some clients wouldn’t pay her and she would loose capital. That is why she is starting, with her husband, to work and invest everything in the bakery. With this loan she will purchase sacks of flour for baking bread so as not to lack inventory, and also sugar, lard, cinnamon, cheese, and more. The goal is to increase sales and the variety of products. She gives thanks to AFODENIC for the opportunity to support the small business person.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour, cheese, cinnamon, sugar for baking more bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of General Food Products

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
La socia GIOVANA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 32 años de edad y tiene dos hijos. La socia y sus hijos viven en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de agua mineral en botellas en el camino Inca (ruta para llegar a la ciudadela de los Incas, Machupicchu). Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar y vender más mercadería como gaseosas y agua mineral, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
GIOVANA is a member of the Communal Bank “LLANKACHINAPAC”. She is 32 years old and has two children. She and her children live in Urubamba Province which is located North of the city of Cuzco. She sells mineral water in bottles along the Inca Trail (the route traveled to reach the sacred city of the Incas, Machupicchu). She's been doing this work for several years and it has gone very well due to all the effort she puts into her work. She is a young mother, hard-working and enterprising, who wants to build a better futre for her family. Giovana is asking for a loan to buy and sell more merchandise such as sodas, and mineral waters, so that she can enlarge her business and achieve higher earnings to give her children a better quality of life. She appreciates the opportunity provided by this medium (the Communal Bank and KIVA) and she promises to pay back the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell more merchandise such as sodas and mineral waters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a Sewing Machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Beans and Maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Fish

loans.name: Moe

texts.en:
After a seventeen-year career in industrial manufacturing, Moe wanted to change the course of his life by becoming his own boss and controlling his own destiny. He considered opening his own convenience store, running a gas station, and possibly opening a restaurant. Ultimately, he found a new career that finally put his computer and graphic design skills to use.
 
In 2006 Moe became the new owner of Stop Signs, Inc. “I make signs that go on buildings, road signs, and real estate signs. We do all kind of signs – illuminated and non-illuminated, including exterior channel letters. We cover the whole sign-making process from “concept to design to manufacturing.”
 
Business has been growing for Moe since 2006, but in the past year revenue has stabilized. “We’re not growing like we used to. But we’re surviving – we’re keeping our heads above water!” says Moe.
 
But this past summer, Moe’s most expensive piece of equipment – the lift truck he uses to install large outdoor signs on the sides of buildings – broke down. Moe went to his local bank for a loan and was turned down, but they referred him to Opportunity Fund, his local microfinance institution. A $10,000 loan will allow Moe to buy a new lift truck so that he can install his signs more quickly and more safely.
 
Moe’s dreams for his business are to continue serving his local community with quality designed signs and eventually to franchise Stop Signs, Inc. across the nation. “I am proud that I learned this business and became a master sign maker. It’s so different from what I used to do. But I’m great at it. We can handle any job and I am proud of the risk I took to pursue my dream to be my own boss!”

loans.use: To buy a lift truck to install the shop's large outdoor signs

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia GREGORIA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  

La socia tiene 59 años D. edad. La socia vive en la provincia D. Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte D. la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene una tienda D. abarrotes y su esposo se dedica a la fabricación D. muebles D. sala como sofás y sillas tapizadas. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales para la fabricación D. muebles como madera y telas y para la tienda D. abarrotes comprar más comestibles como arroz, azúcar, leche  y gaseosas, así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gregoria belongs to the communal group LLANKACHINAPAC. She is 59 years old and lives in the Urabamba province, north of Cusco. Our client has a grocery store and her husband manufactures living room furniture like sofas and upholstered chairs. It has been many years since she started working in this business and it has gone very well thanks to the determination she has put in this business. She is a hard working and enterprising mother that wants her family to move ahead. She needs a loan to buy more materials like wood and upholstery for furniture manufacture and food stuffs like rice, sugar, milk and sodas for her general store so she can increase her business capital and income and give her family a better quality of life. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this loan and promises to fulfill her obligation to payback this loan corresponding to the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and upholstery for furniture manufacture and rice, sugar, milk and sodas for her general store

loans.name: Elsi Varinia

texts.es:
La socia ELSI VARINIA pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”.  
  
La socia tiene 34 años de edad. La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba que se encuentra ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de la cabina de Internet. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para implementar la cabina de Internet comprando computadoras y muebles así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elsi Varinia is a member of the communal bank Llankachinapac.

She is 34 years old and lives in the Urubamba province, north of Cusco. She alternates her activities between the home and her Internet booth. It has been many years since she started working in this business and it has been successful thanks to her dedication she has put in the business. Our client is a hard working and enterprising mother that wants her family to move ahead. She requires a loan to set up her internet booth, buying computers and furniture so she can increase her business capital and income and give her family a better quality of life.

She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this loan and promises to fulfill her obligation to payback this loan corresponding to the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy computers and furniture to set up an internet booth

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
SEBASTIANA M. S., DE  72 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE HACE CUATRO AÑOS INTEGRA EL GRUPO “PRIMAVERA” , FORMADO POR 9 PERSONAS MAS RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE COLLIQUE EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
ELLA TIENE 10 HIJOS, QUIENES LA APOYAN ECONÓMICAMENTE, PERO COMO SIEMPRE HA SIDO UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA, ES ASÍ QUE HACE SEIS AÑOS SE INICIÓ COMO AMBULANTE EN LA VENTA DE GOLOSINAS, CON UN PRÉSTAMO QUE SOLICITÓ AL  BANCO  COMPRÓ UNA CARRETA QUE LE SERVÍA PARA COLOCAR SUS GOLOSINAS.
CON ÉSTE TRABAJO PUEDE MANTENER A SUS DOS NIETOS QUIENES SE QUEDARON A SU CARGO, DEBIDO A QUE SU PADRE LOS ABANDONÓ Y LAMADRE DE LOS NIÑOS TUVOPROBLEMAS POR LOS QUE NO PUEDE HACERSE CARGO DE ELLOS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA AUMENTAR SU MERCADERÍA
texts.en:
Sebastiana M. S. is 72 years old and has been a member of the communal bank “Primavera” for four years. “Primavera” is comprised of nine members who are residents of Collique in the district of Comas. Sebastiana has ten children who help support her economically, but she has always been a woman who works. This is why she began to sell sweets as an ambulatory vendor six years ago. She got started with a bank loan and bought a cart to load her sweets on. This is how she is able to maintain the two grandchildren she is taking care of, since their father abandoned them, and their mother had some problems and could not care for them. She will use the loan to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in purchase of sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Fabric and Shoes and Café Maintenance

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
JANET ISABEL C. A., TIENE 41 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE 4 HIJOS, Y A PESAR D. ESTAR SEPARA D. SU ESPOSO, TIENE UNA BUENA RELACIÓN PARA EL BINESTAR D. SUS HIJOS.
JANET, INTEGRA EL GRUPO “NUEVO AMANECER”, AL  IGUAL QUE SEIS SOCIAS MAS QUE VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS.
HACE SEIS MESES INCIÓ EN LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA A TRAVES D. CATALOGOS, FUE INVITADA POR UNA AMIGA A PARTICIPAR Y LE HA IDO BIEN.
ADEMAS TRABAJA EN UNA EMPRESA D. PROGRAMACION D. EVENTOS LOS FINES D. SEMANA, LE GUSTO MUCHO ESTA LÍNEA D. TRABAJO POR LO QUE TIENE PLANIFICADO EN UN FUTURO TENER SU EMPRESA D. EVENTOS SOCIALES.
CON SU TRABAJO ELLA HA PODIDO LOGRAR UNA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA, APOYAR A SUS HIJOS EN SUS ESTUDIOS Y COMPRATIR GASTOS CON SU ESPOSO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN PEDIDO D. TORTAS
texts.en:
Janet Isabel C. A. is 41 and has four children. In spite of being separated from her husband, she has a good relationship with him for their children’s well being. Janet is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer Group. There are six other members who live in the Comas district. Six months ago she started selling beauty products by catalog. She was invited to participate by a friend. It has gone well for her. She also works in a business which schedules week end events. She really likes this line of work. In the future she plans to have a business of social events. With her work she has been able to achieve economic stability, support her children’s education, and share expenses with her husband. She will use the loan for cake orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cake orders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a Motorbike for Taxi Transport

loans.use: To buy and sell shoes and sandals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy, stock, and sell consumer goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell at retail clothing and baby outfits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell cola, beans, and condiments in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Wholesale and individual sales of corn and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Retail sale of smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Motorbike transport

loans.name: Rosana Ruvelinda

texts.es:
ROSANA RUVELINDA G. S.

Tengo tres hijos menores de edad, a los diez años vendía con mi madre frutas en un puesto que compró, lo que con el tiempo me cedió su negocio a fin de generar mis propios ingresos. Es así que sola tenía que traer la mercadería del mercado de fruta (palta, manzana, granadilla, tumbo, lúcuma, plátanos) y a veces los frutos que daba nuestra chacra; así mismo trabajé limpiando en casas. Tuve que dejar de vender en mi negocio porque mi último bebé necesitaba de mis cuidados. 
Hace cuatro meses decidí acondicionar un espacio de mi casa para expender abarrotes, para ello utilicé el capital que había ahorrado, al inicio mi mercadería era ¼ docena de detergente, ½ doc. de aceite, 2 doc. de leche, ½ doc. atún, 1 doc. gaseosas, ¼ doc.sal, un saco de azúcar. A mi esposo no le agradó la idea porque él quería un negocio más grande con mayores ingresos; ahora es él quien me impulsa a seguir adelante, sé que con mi esfuerzo haré crecer mi tienda. Las ganancias que obtengo implemento más mi tienda; para ello necesito el préstamo para invertir en frutas, pañales, papel higiénico, arroz, azúcar, leche; lo que a futuro será el apoyo para la educación a mis hijos.
texts.en:
Rosana Ruvelinda G. S. I have three minor children. When I was ten, I sold fruit with my mother from a stand that she bought. In time, she gave me her business so that I could generate my own income. That is how I only had to bring the merchandise from the fruit market (avocado, apple, passion fruit, eggfruit, and bananas) and sometimes fruits from our farm. I also worked cleaning houses. I had to stop selling in my business because I needed to take care of my last baby. After four months I decided to set up a space in my house to sell groceries. I used the money that I had saved to do so. Initially my merchandise was ¼ dozen detergents, ½ dozen oils, 2 dozen milk, ½ dozen tuna, 1 dozen soft drinks, ¼ dozen salt, and a sack of sugar. My husband did not like the idea because he wanted a larger business with greater income. Now he is the one who drives me to get ahead. I know that with my effort I will make my store grow. The earnings that I get I use to better set up my store. I need the loan to buy fruit, diapers, toilet paper, rice, sugar, and milk. In the future, this will support my children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell pagnes

loans.name: Ketti Milagritos

texts.es:
R. V. KETTI MILAGRITOS

Trabajo desde hace tres años como microempresaria haciendo toda clase de tejidos a palitos y máquina. Estudié en un CEO algunos cursos cortos como computación e informática, corte confección, tejido porque después de la separación de mi pareja tuve que afrontar sola los gastos de mi hijo de siete años, de mi madre y míos.
Era indispensable contar con una máquina tejedora lo cual no contaba con el capital para adquirirlo, al ver mi cuñado el empeño de mis trabajos que hacía en el taller donde estudiaba me regaló la herramienta (máquina tejedora) para emprender en este negocio, así empecé haciendo ropomcitos para bebés, colchitas, ajuares, gorritos ofreciéndoles a mis amigas las confecciones, les gustaron mis trabajos que después solicitaron más pedidos. Es una distracción tejer porque lo hago los fines de semana además me da tiempo para trabajar en la librería de mi hermana. Las ganancias de estas ventas me permiten solventar los gastos de alimentación, educación, y servicios básicos de mi hogar; como también pude adquirir una licuadora, televisor. Necesito del préstamo para invertir en conos de hijos de varios tonos, botones, elástico, cintas de colores, y algunos repuestos para mi máquina; las prendas lo venderé en esta campaña de navidad donde hay más demanda.
texts.en:
R. V. Ketti Milagritos For three years I have worked as a small businesswoman making all types of knitting by hand and by machine. I took some short courses like computer science, sewing and cutting, and weaving at a CEO (Occupational Education Center). After separating from my life partner I had to face the expenses alone for my seven year old son, my mother, and myself. It was indispensable to have a knitting machine, but I did not have the money to get one. When my brother-in-law saw the effort that I put into the work I made in the shop where I studied, he gave me the tool (knitting machine) to undertake this business. That is how I started making baby clothes, quilts, layettes, and hats. I offered them to my friends, they liked my work, and later they ordered more. Knitting is a distraction because I do it on the week ends. Also, it gives me time to work in my sister’s bookstore. The earnings from these sales allow me to pay for food, education, and the basic service expenses of my home. I was also able to get a blender and television. I need the loan to buy cones of various colors of thread, buttons, elastic, colored ribbons, and some replacement parts for my machine. I will sell the items during this Christmas season when there is more demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for knitting with wool and thread

loans.name: Juntos Progresamos Group

texts.es:
SONIA, TIENE  48 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA TIENE TRES HIJOS, Y DESD. HACE TRES AÑOS ES INTEGRANTE  DEL GRUPO “JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS” AL IGUAL QUE NUEVE SOCIAS MAS QUE VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS.
LA SRA. SONIA ERA TRABAJADORA D. UNA EMPRESA D. ELECTRICIDAD, AL SALIR D. ÉSTA EMPRESA, CON LA LIQUIDACIÓN QUE RECIBIÓ INVIRTIÓ PARA PONER UN NEGOCIO Y DESD. HACE DIEZ AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA, LENCERÍA, ARTEFACTOS Y OTROS PRODUCTOS TODAS LAS TARDES EN SU CASA Y EN LAS MAÑANAS ALQUILA UN PUESTO D. BAZAR EN EL MERCADO SANTA TERESITA.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO HACER LOS ACABADOS DELPRIMER PISO D. SU CASA Y CONSTRUIR EL SEGUNDO PISO, PERO SEGUIRÁ TRABAJANDO CON EL  MISMO ENTUSIASMO PARA LOGRAR EL TECHADO.
