EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO DESTINARÁ A LA COMPRA D. JUGUETES PARA LA CAMPAÑA NAVID.ÑA Y LA COMPRA D. UNA VITRINA PARA EXHIBIRLOS
texts.en:
Sonia is 48 years old, is married and has three children. For the last three years, she has been a member of the group "Juntos Progresamos" along with nine other members who all live in the district of Comas. Mrs. Sonia was a worker in an electric company. Upon leaving the company, she invested her severance payment in starting a business. For the last ten years she has sold beauty products, lingerie, appliances and other products every afternoon in her house. In the mornings, she rents a booth in the Santa Teresita open market. With her work she has been able to finish construction on the first floor of her house and to construct the second floor. But she will keep working with the same enthusiasm to be able to add the roof. She is requesting a loan to buy children's toys for the Christmas season and to buy display case to put them in.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Toys

loans.name: Josefina Micaela

texts.es: La señora Josefina Menchú Tiene 32 años de edad, es Casada y con oficios  Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un Taller, habita junto  a su Esposo, se dedican al mismo oficio,  llevan 8 años  de laborar en  su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Libertad, de la  Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de aumentar su capital para comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Josefina Menchú is 32 years old, married and is a weaver by trade. She works at a workshop “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres”. She lives with her husband who works as a weaver as well. They have worked in their place of residence Caserió la Libertad, Aldea Vásquez, Totonicapán, Guatamala for 8 years. Her client demand has increased but her economic situation is such that she doesn’t have sufficient cash on hand to increase her business capital. For this reason she came to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan, with the intention of increasing her capital by buying raw materials. In this way she can increase her sales in the hope of helping her family move forward and have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Hilda Beelaida

texts.es: El Señora Hilda G. tiene 23 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su familia, ella y su familia  se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, llevan 8 años de elaborar  Cortes Típicos en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Libertad, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella y  pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda Garcia is 23 years old, single and has been dedicated to the craft and loom knitting business for 8 years. She has 2 looms in her workshop and two employees.

Mrs. Garcia lives with her family in the “Caserío la Libertad, Vasquez village, Totonicapán state- Guatemala. The demand of her products has grown, but her economic situation is not good enough to increase the production. She is asking to ASDIR Association for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of materials that will allow her to increase her sales and keep supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Curva Pucara  Sector  Laja   de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañil en la misma zona y sembrado de papa y otros.

 Tiene cinco hijos  los cuales  se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Alejandra raises cattle whose milk she sells to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).

She lives in the community of Curva Pucara Sector Laja in the Los Andes Province in the La Paz department located three hours from the city of La Paz.

Her husband works as an assistant brick-layer in the same area and plants potatoes and other crops.

They have five children who are school age.

The loan will go to buying cattle of a better breed and so will increase the milk production and therefore their income.

This is her first loan with Impro, the completed evaluation qualified her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.es:
Fabiano se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Curva Pucara  Sector  Laja   de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Su esposa le colabora con los cuidados del ganado y quehaceres  del hogar. 

Como segunda actividad trabaja como albañil en la misma zona.
 
 Tiene seis hijos de los cuales  se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos..
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Fabiano raises cattle, and he sells the milk they produce to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). He lives in the Curva Pucara community in the sector of Laja, province of Los Andes, department of La Paz, located three hours outside the city of La Paz. His wife assists him in caring for the herd and with the household chores. As a second job, he works as a bricklayer in the same part of the city. He has six children, all of whom are school aged. This loan will be used to buy cattle of a better breed, and thereby increase his milk production and his income as well. This is his first loan with Impro, and the initial assessment qualified him to be granted one.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Sullcataca Alta sector  Laja   de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Como segunda actividad  se dedica al cultivo de papa y otros en su propiedad.

Su esposa le colabora con el cuidado de su hogar y el ganado.

  
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos..
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Gerardo raises cattle, and he sells the milk that his herd produces to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). He lives in the Sullcataca Alta community in the sector of Laja, province of Los Andes, department of La Paz, located three hours outside the city of La Paz. As a second job, he also grows potatoes and other things on his land. His wife assists him in caring for their home and their herd. This loan will be used to buy a better breed of cattle, and thereby increase his milk production and his income as well. This is his first loan with Impro, and the initial assessment qualified him to be granted one.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Sullcataca Baja sector  Laja   de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Como segunda actividad  ella trabaja como profesora escolar en la ciudad de El Alto, mientras su esposo es quien se encarga de los cuidados  del ganado y también el cuidado de sus hijos los cuales están entre los 5 y 3 años respectivamente.

  
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Maribel raises cattle and sells the milk that her herd produces to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). She lives in the Sullcataca Baja community in the sector of Laja, province of Los Andes, department of La Paz, located three hours outside the city of La Paz. As a second job, she also works as a schoolteacher in the city of El Alto while her husband is responsible for the care of their herd as well as the care of their children, who are between the ages of 5 and 3 respectively. This loan will be used to buy a better breed of cattle, and thereby increase her production of milk and her income as well. This is her first loan with Impro, and the initial assessment qualified her to be eligible for one.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro vive en la calle “Manoa”  de la zona Brasil en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es soltero vive en unas habitaciones las cuales tomo en alquiler.

Trabaja en la confección de chamarras y buzos deportivos a poca escala, los cuales vende a los intermediarios.
 

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de telas y cuero al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos.
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Ramiro lives on Manoa Street in the Brasil area of the city of El Alto. He is single and lives in some rented rooms. He makes jackets and tracksuits on a small scale and he sells them through intermediaries. He will use the loan to purchase fabric and leather wholesale and thereby lower his costs. This is his first loan with Impro whose evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Sullcataca Baja sector  Laja  de la Provincia los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es soltero vive junto a sus padres y sus hermanos menores, los cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad. 

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de forraje, ya que por esta época de pocas lluvias no existe mucha producción de forraje para alimento del ganado.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Edwin raises dairy cows and sells their milk to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant).

He lives in the community Sullcataca Baja sector Laja, Los Andes province, department of La Paz, located 3 hours from the city of La Paz.

He is single and lives with his parents and younger siblings, who study at the community’s school.

The loan will be used to buy animal feed since now is the time of little rain and there is not much animal feed production.

This is his first loan with Impro; the completed evaluation indicates that he is qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Copajira Sector  Laja   de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Como segunda actividad, se dedica a la siembra de papa y otros productos

 Vive junto a su esposa la cual le colabora con los trabajos del campo.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos..
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Francisco raises cattle and sells the milk to PIL Andina (a milk processing plant). He lives in the community of Copajira in the Laja sector of the Los Andes province in the region of La Paz, which is situated three hours away from the city of La Paz itself. As a secondary job, he grows potatoes and other produce. He lives with his wife, with whom he collaborates to complete the farm work. The loan will be used to buy cattle and in this way augment their milk production and thus their income. This is his first loan with Impro; an evaluation has qualified him to receive the financing.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
Jacinto se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Copajira sector  Guaqui  de la Provincia Ingavi del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante de materiales de construcción los cuales adquiere en la ciudad de El Alto y los vende en la localidad de Guaqui. 

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Jacinto is employed in raising cattle, whose milk he sells to PIL Andina (Industrialized Milk Plant).

He lives in the community of Copajira, in the Guaqui sector of Ingavi Province, in the Department of La Paz, located three and a half hours away from the city of La Paz.

He lives together with his wife, who works selling construction materials that she buys in the city of El Alto and sells around Guaqui.

He will use the loan to purchase improved breeds of cattle and thereby increase his milk production, as well as his income.

This is his first loan with IMPRO, and the evaluation that was done qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Asociacion Unidas Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL 
ASOCIACION UNIDAS
Carolina fue profesora hace muchos años, es una mujer muy empeñosa en lo que hace; se embarazó de su segunda hija y ya no pudo ejercer su profesión, fue entonces que con mucho esfuerzo consiguió una “carreta” donde vender algunos productos como especerías, que eso lo podía hacer en casa. Comenzó vendiendo en la calle,  luego se instalo en el mercado alquilando un pequeño espacio desde hace 6 años. Sus ingresos  le ayuda a poder mantener a su familia.
La tesorera Lola  vende comida hace 9 años, comenzó vendiendo en su casa,luego de algún tiempo alquilo un puesto en el mercado, eso la ayudo con el aporte para las necesidades básicas de sus familia; tiene dos hijos de los cuales solo se está haciendo cargo de uno de ellos ya que el otro puede mantenerse con sus propios recursos.
La secretaria Viviana tiene su wawa wuasi (Guardería de niños) desde hace 3 años, funciona en su propio domicilio; la socia nos comenta que el gobierno proporciona los alimentos a los niños además de pagarle un alquiler por su casa, ella tiene 6 hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar y este tipo de trabajo la beneficia mucho ya que puede pagar algunos gastos en casa; considerando que con los seis hijos los gastos son tremendos y nunca es suficiente. 
La alcancía Comunal tiene varios años de fundado y demuestran ser puntuales y responsables en sus respectivos pagos.
texts.en:
United Association Community Bank Carolina was a teacher for many years, and is very determined in all she does. When she became pregnant with her second daughter and was no longer able to practice her profession, with much effort she obtained a cart where she could sell various products like spices that she could make at home. She started by selling in the street, then she established herself in the market renting a small space for the past 6 years. Her income helps her to support her family.

The treasurer Lola has sold food for the past 9 years. She started selling from her home, some time later she rented a stand in the market. This helps her contribute to her family's basic needs. She has two sons of which she is taking care of just one, since the other supports himself by his own means.

The secretary Viviana has conducted her "wawa wuasi" (children's daycare) for three years in her own home. She informs us that the government provides food for the children in addition to paying for the rental of her house. She has 6 school-age children and this type of work provides many benefits since it lets her pay for some of her household expenses, keeping in mind that her expenses with 6 children are significant and there is never enough.

The Community Bank has been in existence for several years and its members have shown themselves to be punctual and responsible with their respective payments.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Julia Liliana

texts.es:
JULIA LILIANA

Soy madre de dos hijos, casada y mi edad es 42 años. Hace más de 3 años que trabajo como microempresaria lo hice por necesidad para apoyar a mi esposo en los gastos de nuestra familia. Antes de tener mi negocio de comida rápida ambulatoria tuve que trabajar vendiendo pan y galletas los fines de semana en los pueblos de la sierra, aprovechaba mi viaje para traer los pedidos que me hacían de queso y tubérculos. Así mismo expendía caldo de gallina en el mercado de Chosica y los ingresos eran para mi hogar, lo dejé posteriormente debido a que estaba descuidando a mis hijos. Entonces aproveché más tarde a vender fuera de mi casa hamburguesas con el carrito sandwichera que me prestó mi hermana, a decir verdad al principio las pocos platos que hacía de alitas fritas y hamburguesas no lo vendía por completo, lo que sobraba lo teníamos que comer, no desistí en vender sabía que con paciencia y perseverancia esto iba a mejorar; así fue con el tiempo mi clientela aumentó. Actualmente tengo mi propio carrito que lo obtuve de los préstamos que me hice, compré mercadería de insumos para este negocio, tasas, platos. Recientemente acondicioné un espacio de mi casa para colocar una mesita e instalé una puerta enrolladora. Quiero comprar dos mesitas con sus sillas que me hacen falta; por ello requiero del préstamo además de surtirlo con bebidas e insumos (platos y cubiertos descartables, panes, cremas, hamburguesas, lechuga, pollo) Utilizo la ganancia en apoyar a mi hijo en sus estudios ya que muy pronto egresará y necesitará de un capital para obtener el título en mecánica automotriz; del mismo modo me responsabilizo con algunos servicios básicos y alimentación.
texts.en:
JULIA LILIANA I am a married mother of two. I am 42 years old. For three years I have worked as a small businesswoman. I began out of necessity--to help my husband with household costs. Before having my business selling food to-go I had to work selling bread and cookies every weekend in the hill towns. I took advantage of my trips by bringing their orders of cheese and potatoes. Likewise, I sold chicken soup en the Chosica market, and the profit made went to household costs. I later left the job because it didn't give me enough time to take care of my children. Later I took advantage of selling hamburgers outside my home with the sandwich cart my sister lent me. To tell the truth, I didn't sell all the plates of chicken wigs and hamburgers I made in the beginning. What was left over we had to eat. I didn't stop selling because I knew with patience and perseverance that it would start to get better. With time, my number of customers grew. Recently, I fixed up a space in my house to put a little table. I installed a rolling door. I want to buy two more little tables and chairs. To buy them, I need a loan. I will also use the loan to stock up on drinks and other supplies (disposable plates and silverware, bread, sauces, hamburgers, lettuce, chicken). I will use the profits to support my son in his studies. He is graduating high school very soon and will need the money to get a degree in automobile mechanics. At the same time, I am responsible for basic services and foods.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tables, chairs, silverware

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Sullcataca Baja sector  Laja  de la Provincia los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa, la cual colabora con los quehaceres de la casa  y cuidado del ganado.

Como segunda actividad trabajo como chofer asalariado de transporte interprovincial. 

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de ganado de raza mejorada
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Saturnino raises cattle. He sells the milk they produce to PIL Andino, an industrial milk plant. He lives in the Sullcataca Baja community, in the sector of Laja, in the Andes Province, in the department of La Paz. It is located three hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with with his wife. They work together to complete the household chores and take care of the livestock. He works a second job as a wage-earning driver for inter-provincial transport. This loan will be used to buy better livestock. This is his first loan with Impro. An evaluation was done that qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying livestock

loans.name: Susana Petrona

texts.es: La señora Susana T.  tiene 52 años de edad, es Casada cuanta  con un taller, habita junto  a su Esposo, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad,  lleva 8  años de elaborar  en los oficios ya mencionados su  residencia  se encuentra en el Paraje Xelajcruz, Cantón Paqui, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  por las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para incrementar su negocio, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Susana T. is 52 years old. She is married and has a workshop. She lives with her husband. They are the two employees of their business. For eight years, they have worked in this trade. Their residence is in Paraje Xelajcruz, Cantón Paqui, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. The economic conditions that they find themselves in are not sufficient to expand their business. Therefore, they have come to the Asociación ASDIR and requested a loan. They hope this will increase their sales, hoping also to move forward with their family and have better conditions in life.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for artisan work

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Copajira sector  Guaqui  de la Provincia Ingavi del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa y su hijo mayor el cual le colabora con los trabajos del campo y  cuidado del ganado. 

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Teofilo raises cattle. He sells their milk to PIL Andina, an industrial milk plant. He lives in the community of Copajira, in the sector of Guaqui, in the Ingav province, in the department of La Paz. It is located three and half hours from the city of La Paz. He lives together with his wife and his eldest daughter. They help him with farm work and taking care of the cattle. The loan will be used to buy better cattle that will produce more milk and make more money. This is his first loan with Impro. An evaluation was done that qualified him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Héctor Manuel

texts.es: Don Héctor  Z. tiene 36 años de edad, es Casado de oficios tejedor,  habita junto  con su esposa, él se dedica en la elaboración de ropa típica ,  llevan  6  años de vender,   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Chichaclan  del  Cantón Paqui, del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Don Héctor Z. is 36 years old, married, and a weaver by trade. He and his wife produce traditional clothing which they have been selling for six years. They live in the village of Chichaclan del Cantón Paqui, in the town and department Totonicapán, Guatemala.

Don Héctor is experiencing an increase in customer demand, but he does not have sufficient capital due to his current financial situation. For this reason, he has come to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. He intends to buy raw materials in order to increase his sales. Don Héctor hopes to move his family forward and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Ninachiri Sector  Kallutaca   de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Como segundo trabajo, se dedica a la venta de comida en la ciudad de El Alto mientras su esposo es quien se encarga de los trabajos del campo.

 Tiene seis hijos de los cuales cuatro son independientes y los menores se encuentran en edad escolar.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro y el segundo vía KIVA, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Petrona raises dairy cattle. The milk produced by her animals is sold to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant). She lives in the community of Ninachiri, Kallutaca Sector, Los Andes Province, Department of La Paz. Her residence is located four hours away from the city of La Paz.

As a second job, Petrona sells food in the city of El Alto. Her husband is in charge of the work in their fields. They have six children, of whom four are independent. The rest are of school age.

This loan will be used to buy cattle of good breed so that she can increase her milk production, as well as her income. This is her third loan with IMPRO and the second one posted on Kiva. Her evaluation indicated that she is qualified to receive this loan.

(Click HERE to view the previous loan.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy cattle

loans.name: Micaela Villegas Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL MICAELA VILLEGAS
La Alcancía Comunal Micaela Villegas está ubicada en distrito del El Agustino, se encuentra representada por la Sra. Rossangel que es un socia muy optimista y responsable al igual que sus 10 integrantes.
La socia se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, ya que por diversos inconvenientes aun no ha podido alquilar un puesto en el mercado, pero eso no se da por vencida, también vende productos de belleza por catalogo la cual ofrece a sus muchas clientes, eso la ayuda con sus gastos familiares. 
Vicente es un socio del grupo se dedica a la fabricación y venta de prendas de vestir hace muchos años, empezó desde muy joven, labor por el cual le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, ahora tiene un taller de confecciones en el cual trabaja con su familia, Como siempre el es muy entusiasta, desea continuar su trabajo para brindarle lo necesario a su familia aunque hay mucho camino por recorrer aún. 
El grupo se destaca por tener socios puntuales en sus pagos  ya que todos se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio y/o servicios con el cual pueden sustentar a su familia que es lo más importante para ellos. El crédito recibido será destinado para la compra de productos e insumos que le ayudan  a incrementar sus ganancias, además aprovechar la campaña navideña, siempre se vende un poquito más, manifiestan los integrantes.
texts.en:
The Micaela Villegas Communal Bank is located in the district of El Agustino. The group is led by Sra. Rossangel, one of the 10 members who display optimism and responsibility.

Rossangel sells clothing by order. Due to several setbacks, she still has not been able to rent a stall in the market. However, she does not give up. She also sells beauty products by catalog and offers her merchandise to many of her customers. The income she generates helps with the family expenses.

Vincent is a member of the group who has been manufacturing and selling garments for many years. He started working at a young age. His jobs have brought him much satisfaction. He now has a clothing shop where he works alongside his family. Vincent is always enthusiastic and desires to continue working so that he can meet his family’s needs. However, there is still a long road ahead.

The members of the group are known for making their payments on time. They all engage in various trades and services in order to support their families, who are of great importance to them. The loan they receive will be used to purchase products and supplies to help boost their profits during the Christmas season. During this time of year, the members say they sell a little more than usual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche es comercializada a la planta industrializadora de leche PIL ANDINA El crédito lo destinara en la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sergio raises dairy cattle. The milk from his cows is sold to the industrial milk plant of PIL Andina, a large food manufacturer.

This loan will be used to buy higher quality cows, and in this way increase milk production and profits.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Munay Kente Ii Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “MUNAY KENTE”. Este banco comunal está conformado por 10 miembros, ellos se reúnen una vez al mes en el local principal de La Asociación Arariwa.  

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio minorista en la ciudad del Cusco, una gran parte se dedica a la venta de comida, de artículos, de granos, etc. Los socios Raúl y Alex se dedican al servicio de transporte en la ciudad. Las socias Francisca y Juana son empleadas domesticas. La socia Leonor se dedica a la venta de granos como maíz, cebada, trigo y mucho más. La socia Yanet trabaja como secretaria.  

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital de trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(Las socias Juana y Leonor no aparecen en la fotografía porque pidieron permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal y se fueron antes de tomar la foto).
texts.en:
Our members belong to the communal bank "Munay Kente". This village bank consists of 10 members that meet once a month at the Arariwa Association's main office. Our partners alternate their various activities with retailing in the city Cusco. A large part is devoted to selling food items, grains, etc. The members Raul and Alex work in transportation services in the city. Members Francisca and Juana are domestic employees. The member Leonor sells grains, such as corn, barley, wheat and more. Member Yanet works as a secretary. They are requesting the loan in order to use it as work capital to increase their products and sales, and thus to provide a better quality of life for their families. They value and appreciate this loan granted through this medium. Likewise, they agree to pay their dues on time. (Members Juana and Leonor do not appear in the picture because they were given permission from the communal bank's board to leave before taking the picture).

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use it as work capital and increase their products and sales

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 45 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad.  Ella vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes les heredó.  Realiza su negocio en su casa propia la cual ubica en el distrito de la Tinguiña. Se dedica a la confeccion y la venta de ropa desde hace más de 3 años.  Se inició el negocio con una pequeña maquina.  Actualmente tiene 3 maquinas, 2 de ellas para costura simple y una remalladora. Ella confecciona ropas, sabanas, y toallas de baño. Su esperanza es de ampliar su taller de costura. El crédito que solicita es para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Julia is 45 years old and has a 14 year old son. She lives in a house she inherited from her parents. Her business is located in her own home, which is located in the Tinguiña district. She has devoted herself to sewing and selling clothing for the past three years. She started her business with a small machine. Currently she has three machines; two of them for simple sewing and another is an overlocker. She makes clothing, bed sheets, and bath towels. She hopes that she can expand her sewing shop. The loan she is requesting is for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora María R. se dedica arduamente a su trabajo para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar ya que ella es madre soltera y con cuatro hijos a su cargo de los cuales tres de ellos estudian.
Es de importancia destacar que ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superarse en la vida. Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en el pago de matriculas del colegio de sus hijos por lo que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera suplir las necesidades de sus pequeños que tanto los ama.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Mrs. María R. works very hard at her job to improve the conditions of her home since she is now a single mother of four children, three of whom study. It is important to point out that she is a very hard working woman with a great desire to get ahead in life. She is asking for a loan to pay for the school registration fees of her children, and hopes her loan is approved so she can supply for the needs of her little ones she loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her children's school enrollment fees

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 39 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de edades 16 y 14.  Es madre soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos como recorredora hace más de 10 años. Ella compra sus productos en la ciudad de Trujillo y luego los entrega a sus clientes en sus domicilios.  Su vivienda está ubicado en el distrito de la Tinguiña en la avenida principal. En su casa tiene una pequeña vitrina el cual exide sus productos. Ella comenzó con escasos recursos y ha logrado en crecer su negocio. Solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo ahora por la campaña navideña. Su sueño para el futuro es seguir creciendo su negocio el cual es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 39 years old and has two children who are 16 and 14 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her parents' home. She has worked selling shoes for more than 10 years. She buys her products in the city of Trujillo and later brings them to her clients' homes. Her home is located in the Tinguiña district on the main avenue. In her home she has a small display window where she displays her products. She started out with limited resources and has been able to grow in her business. She is asking for a loan for purchasing products for the Christmas season. Her dream in the future is to keep growing her business, as it is her main source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in shoes/merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 D. Junio”, vive en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 50 años D. edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta D. ovejas criollas.
La señora Isabel no tiene estudios y tiene 5  hijos..
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 6 meses atrás. Su primer préstamo fue D.  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra D. ovejas.

Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  D. ovejas cara negra.

Su deseo para el futuro es comprar mas animales como toros y así poder vivir mejor.

Lo que mas le gusta D. su organización es el ahorro y las reuniones que se dan.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the "24 D. Junio" Community Bank. She lives in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao in the town of Puno. Isabel is 50 years old and is married. She has 5 children and has not had an education. Her business involves buying and selling native sheep. Isabel worked with "Movimiento Manuela Ramos" 6 months ago and obtained a loan for S/.500.00 soles, which she used to purchase sheep. Now, she has requested an additional loan of S/ 1200.00 soles, which she will use again to purchase more sheep (blackface breed). Her hope for the future is to purchase more animals like bulls so that she can have a better life. What she enjoys about the "Movimiento Manuela Ramos" organization are the savings and the meetings they hold.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE UNA OVEJA CARA NEGRA (purchase of "blackfaced" sheep)

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Doña Martina tiene 65 años de edad, es casada y madre de 08 hijos (05 hijos con familia y 03 varones solteros), ella solo estudió primer año de primaria, vive en el  Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró ovinos para su posterior venta, desde los 04 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno, ovino y alpacas conjuntamente con su esposo.

Ella seguirá con su negocio, para ello solicitará un nuevo crédito de 2,500.00 nuevos soles para comprar 01 ganado vacuno mejorado.

Su sueño es que sus hijos salgan adelante y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Martina is 65 years old, married and mother of 8 children (5 of her children have their own families and 3 are single men). The education she received was only through first grade. She lives in the District of Ilave, Province of El Collao, in the town of Puno. Martina is one of the founding members of the "Jesus de Nazaret" Community Bank, and with the first loan she received she purchased sheep. Since then, for four years now, she has been buying and selling cattle, sheep and alpacas together with her husband. She plans on continuing with her business and is requesting a loan of 2,500.00 soles to purchase a bull. Her dream is that her sons will get ahead and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRAR 01 VACUNO MEJORADO (to purchase a bull)

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca tiene 35 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad de 14 y 8 años en edad ambos en edad  escolar. Ella es conviviente, su conyuge trabaja como chofer de transporte urbano. Cuenta con casa propia de material rustico la cual está en reconstruccion despues del terremoto quedó  destruido. Actualmente tiene la parte adelante de cercados de estera y tiene sus habitaciones de adobe. Su casa está ubicado en el Distrito de la Tinguiña. Blanca se dedica como ayudante de una peluqueria. Ella se dedica a esto hace 6 años. Blanca tiene muchos objetivos y metas uno de ellos es poder reconstruir su vivienda.  Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Blanca is 35 years old and has two children, 14 and 8 years old, both in school. She lives with her partner who works as a public transport driver. She owns her own rustic home which is being rebuilt after being destroyed by the earthquake. Currently the front part of the house is closed in by mats, while the rooms are made of adobe. Her home is located in the Tinguiña district. For the past six years, Blanca has worked as a hair salon assistant. She has many objectives and goals, and one of them is to rebuild her home. The money she is asking for will be invested in improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement of her home that was destroyed in an earthquake

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
GLADYS,  ES UNA MUJER EMPRENDEDORA, TIENE 41 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS, ELL. ES UNA DE LAS  10 INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO “SAN JUAN” QUIENES VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
HACE CINCO AÑOS, INICIÓ  SU NEGOCIO DE L. VENTA DE VINOS EN SU CASA, ESTO CON L. IDEA DE JUNTAR UN CAPITAL E INICIAR UNA EMPRESA FAMILIAR. ES ASI QUE ALQUILARON UN LOCAL PARA INAUGURAR UN RESTAURANTE, DONDE TODA L. FAMILIA PARTICIPA Y TRABAJAN TODOS LOS DÍAS. ES UN RESTAURANT MUY CONCURRIDO DONDE OFRECEN COMIDAS MARINAS Y CRIOLLAS.
GLADYS NOS COMENTA QUE ES UN TRABAJO MUY SACRIFICADO, PERO MUY RENTABLE  Y SATISFACTORIO.
CON SU TRABAJO  PUEDE CUBRIR LOS GASTOS DE L. UNIVERSIDAD DE SU HIJA MAYOR QUIEN ESTUDIA CONTABILIDAD. SU PROXIMA META ES AHORRAR PARA COMPRAR SU CASA, YA QUE ELL. Y SU FAMILIA VIVEN EN L. CASA DE SU MAMÁ.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA COMPLEMENTAR Y EQUIPAR EL RESTAURANT E INVERTIR UNA PARTE EN L. COMPRA DE VINOS.
texts.en:
Gladys is an enterprising woman. She is 41, married, and has two children. She is one of the ten members of the San Juan group; they live in the Comas district. Five years ago she started a business of selling wine in her house. She did this with the idea of getting money together to start a family business. That is how they came to rent a place to start a restaurant where all of the family participates and works everyday. It is a popular restaurant, which serves seafood and Peruvian food. Gladys tells us that the work requires a lot of sacrifice, but it is very profitable and satisfactory. With her work she is able to cover the university expenses of her oldest daughter who is studying accounting. Her next goal is to save to buy a house. She and her family live in her mother’s house. The loan she is asking for is to supplement and equip the restaurant. She will use part of the loan to buy wine.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Equip her restaurant

loans.name: Sandra Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Sandra tiene 37 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad de 9 y 4 años en edad escolar. Ella es conviviente. Su conyuge se encuentra trabajando en la ciudad de Lima. Cuenta con casa propia de material noble aun sin acabados.  Está ubicado en el Distrito de la Tinguiña. Sandra se dedica al cuidado de niños en su propio domicilio. Ella se dedica a esto hace 3 años. Sandra tiene muchos objetivos y metas uno de ellos es poder hacer un jardin de estudios para niños. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en mejoramiento de su vivienda.  Gran parte de la casa ya está construida pero sin acabados, y quieren mejorar el piso de la vivienda para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra is 37 years old and is the mother of two children ages 9 and 4 who go to school. Her partner works in Lima. She has her own house but it's not finished. It's located in the Tinguina District. Sandra has been a stay-at-home mother for the past 3 years. She has many goals and dreams and one of them is to build a studying yard for her children. She's asking this loan in order to make improvements to her home. Big part of the house is yet to be built, and she wants to improve the flooring in order to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Irma Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Irma  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 25 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a  la venta de animales menores.

La señora Irma estudio primaria completa y  tiene 3 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 año atrás. Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de lana.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización son las reuniones y sus ahorros
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the "24 de Junio" Community Bank. She lives in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the town of Puno. She is 25 years of age and is married with 3 children. She holds a primary school education. As her business, Irma sells small animals and began working with the "Movimiento Manuela Ramos" organization 3 years ago. Her first loan was for S/ .300.00 new soles, which she used to purchase animals. The new loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wool. Her dream is to open a shop in the future and for her children to grow to become professionals. What she enjoys best about the "Movimiento Manuela Ramos" organization is the meetings and the savings they supply.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE LANA (to purchase wool)

loans.name: Diana Lizbeth

texts.es:
La Sra.Diana C. R. de 21 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hija Danitza Ramos C. de 3 años. Viven en el asentamiento Humano Virgen de Chapi-Subtanjalla-Ica.
Trabaja como Ayudante de Venta de Comida en el CC Polvos Rosados y como trabajadora del Hogar dejando a su niña a cargo de su mamà.
La vivienda que habita actualmente es de esteras y palo no cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua ni desague. Fue afectada por el terremoto y obtuvo un modulo de madera donado por una ONG y solicita el crédito para poder hacer un falso piso y poder armar el módulo.
Cuenta con buenas referencias de los vecinos; ya que es una mujer Jóven con muchas ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
Diana C. R., 21, is a single mother who lives with her 3-year-old daughter, Danitza Ramos C.. They live in the Humano Virgen settlement in Chapi-Subtanjalla-Ica. She works as a food sales assistant at Polvos Rosados Shopping Center and as a domestic; her mother cares for her daughter. The dwelling they inhabit is made of sticks and matting; it lacks electricity, running water and sewerage. It was damaged by the earthquake and she received a wood modular unit from an NGO and she is requesting funding to build a false floor and assemble the modular unit. She has good references from her neighbors in that she is a young woman with a strong desire to work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvement.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: Aurelia es una socia emprendedora y muy colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años de edad, madre de tres hijos todos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a venta de especias(saborizantes para los alimentos), desde hace muchos años, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es electricista. Forma parte del Banco Comunal ´´Las Lomas de Yarina´´ desde hace seis años, ella se siente contenta en el banco y agradece a Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque la ayudo a iniciar el negocio propio y  le a permitido ayudar a sus hijos en su educación, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo invirtió en la compra de artículos de primera necesidad, leche, arroz, aceite, para vender. En la actualidad Aurelia necesita en crédito de 1500 soles, que será utilizado para comprar productos de abarrotes en general para vender en su negocio. La meta de Aurelia es tener una tienda de produstos comestibles bien implementado y amplio para una mayor comodidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Aurelia is an enterprising member and contributes a lot to the group. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district, in the region of Ucayali. Aurelia is 44 years-old and has three children, all no longer minors. She has been working selling spices (flavoring for foods) for many years and has the support of her husband, who is an electrician. She has been a member of the Communal Bank "Las Lomas de Yarina" for six years. Aurelia is very happy with the bank and grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business, which allowed her to help her children get an education. Her first loan was 300 soles, which she invested in the purchase of basic necessities to sell such as milk, rice and oil. Currently Aurelia needs this loan of 1500 soles, which will be used to purchases grocery products to sell in her business. Her goal is to have a well furnished grocery store with a wide selection that will be more comfortable for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general grocery products for resale.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a  la artesanía.

La señora Teresa estudio primaria completa y  tiene 2 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 meses atrás. Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de lana.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de lana.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener mas mercadería y una tienda de artesanía.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización son las reuniones y los ahorros
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the communal bank “24 de Junio” (24 June), she lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, in the Puno department. She is 38 years old and is married. She is a craftswoman. Teresa finished primary school and has 2 children. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the last 3 months. Her first loan was for 500 nuevo soles which was used for the purchase of wool. She is asking for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles, which she will invest in the purchase of wool. Her wish for the future is to have more merchandise and a craft shop. What she likes most about her organisation are the meetings and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF WOOL

loans.name: Justa Alicia

texts.es:
La Señora Justa Alicia S. P. es trabajadora de una Empresa de transporte y servicios múltiples “terminal Costa atlántica” que se ubica en el mercado Iván Montenegro de Managua, la capital de Nicaragua.
Tiene 5 años de trabajar como cajera en esta empresa.

Ella tiene 32 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos en edad escolar, una niña de 12 años y su hijo menor de 6 años que ahora en Diciembre sale Promocionado de Preescolar. Su esposo trabaja en la Fuerza Naval del Ejército de Nicaragua desde hace 9 años como Jefe de Corbata.
Ella tiene un buen record crediticio en nuestra institución y está agradecida con CEPRODEL, ya que estos préstamos le han permitido invertir en la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Justa Alicia S. P., 32, works for a transportation and multiple services company called "Terminal Costa Atlántica” which is located in Managua's Iván Montenegro market. She has worked as a cashier for this company for five years. She is married and has two, school-age, children; a girl 12, and a son, 6, who this December will graduate from pre-school. Her husband is in the Nicaraguan navy and has been a chief on a corvette for the last 9 years. She has a good credit history with our institution and is grateful to CEPRODEL because these loans have allowed her to make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Francisca tiene 53 años D. edad, se casó a los 17 años D. edad y es madre D. 06 hijos  (03 con familia y 03 solteros estudiantes), ella estudió hasta el 3er. Año D. primaria, vive en el  Distrito  D. Ilave  Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno.

DesD. el año 2007 integra el Banco Comunal “Jesús D. Nazaret”, con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró ovinos. Ella se dedica al negocio D. compra y venta D. ganado vacuno, ovino, junto a su esposo desD. que se casó.

Para incrementar su capital y continuar con su negocio solicitará un nuevo crédito D. 2,000.00 nuevos soles para comprar 01 ganado vacuno mejorado.

A ella le gusta asistir a las reuniones del Banco Comunal, porque recibe charlas.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos salgan adelante y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Francisca is 53 years old, she got married at 17 and is the mother of 6 children (3 have a family and 3 are unmarried students), she has 3 years of primary education, lives is the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. Since 2007 she has been part of the communal bank “Jesús D. Nazaret” (Jesus of Nazareth), she bought sheep with her first loan of 300 nuevos soles. She has bought and sold cattle and sheep, alongsiD. her husband since she got married. To increase her capital and continue her business she is asking for a new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy a better breed of cattle. She likes attending the communal bank meetings, because they have talks. Her greatest dream is that her children get ahead and become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF A BETTER BREED OF CATTLE

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of Little Ants Group

texts.en:
The official name of this group translates as “The Women´s Bank of Little Ants”. This group consists of eleven members from the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica in the Cariari region. With this loan, each member will receive a deposit to invest at their discretion. These women have created The Women’s Bank of Little Ants as a formal way to support one another as guarantors of each other’s loans.

The Cariari region is located in the province of Limon. In this rural area, life has been difficult due to a lack of job opportunities, family responsibilities, low levels of formal education and a lack of available financial services. Their challenging situation has resulted in a communal initiative to create work for themselves by engaging wholeheartedly in the purchase, rearing and sale of pigs.

In order to fund the development of their businesses each woman is applying for a loan of 100,000 colons (roughly US$180). Their loans will be used to purchase piglets and nutritional food that will ensure their growth into quality livestock products. The pigs will be sold to people in the community for direct consumption or resale. From November to December is the high season for the group, the reason can be summed up in one word: Tamales. Tamales are a traditional Costa Rican food eaten at Christmas time and their main ingredient is pork. As customer needs for pork meat increase, so too do the revenues of the “Little Ants”.

For many of the group members, the responsibility of raising a family has fallen solely on their shoulders, rendering the income generated from pig sales a vital source of income. Despite their entrepreneurial spirit, their efforts have been hamstrung, partly due to exclusion from the traditional banking system. This is where you, through Kiva’s lending model, can help.

Your contribution is a direct investment in the betterment of the lives of women living in a poor community of Caribbean Costa Rica. By lending to these proactive and hardworking entrepreneurs, you are enabling them to help themselves.

The Group Members

These women identify most with the struggle of “little ants”. The members observe that “ants work together and support one another day and night, in order to build something that is bigger than themselves.” This can be taken to symbolize the group’s aspirations for growth and approval for more loans in the future. The following detailed description of Flor M. A. A. can be considered as generally applicable to all the women in the group: they are all participants in similar economic activities in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica.

Flor M. A. A. is the elected treasurer of this group. She is 38 years old and has not completed high school. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a farmer who grows plantains, rice and beans for family consumption and sells what he has left over.

On average, Flor earns 37,500 colons (roughly US$67) per month. At the moment, she has one pig; she would use this loan to purchase another. She would like to earn enough money from her pig-selling business so that she may buy a cow.

Flor takes pride in managing her business with one hand while raising her children with the other. An obstacle for her, and for all the group members, is the high cost of nutrients for the pigs. Transportation is another challenge: walking to town to get the nutrients and hauling them back is a laborious task. When it rains heavily, the rise in the nearby river makes transport by bus impossible.

The members of The Women´s Bank of Little Ants have lived in the rural zone of Cariari for their entire lives. They are experienced in the trade of livestock and other agricultural activities; for example, Flor has been rearing pigs for the last fifteen years of her life. Your loan will help these women take the first steps in a loan cycle that leads to the end of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Greisi

texts.es: Greisi es una socia  dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 38 años, madre de un hijo adolescente, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, esta actividad lo realiza en su casa, ya que ella trae de la ciudad de Lima su mercadería para vender. Greisi siente que todo este tiempo, en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su situación económica ha mejorado ya que ahora puede aportar un poco mas en los gastos económicos de su hogar, también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es docente de educación. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Lomas de Yarina” desde hace ocho años.  El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo invirtió en la compra de blusas y polos para vender a sus clientes. Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles que será utilizado para comprar prendas de vestir de damas, caballeros y niños. La meta de Greisi es tener un minimarket en su casa y también dedicarse a la venta de calzados.
texts.en:
Greisi is a dynamic and hard-working partner who lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the region of Ucayali. She is 38 years old and the mother of an adolescent son. She makes a living by selling garments, which she does in her house, after bringing her merchandise back from the city of Lima to sell. Greisi feels that during all of this time, in the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, her economic situation has improved, since she can now contribute more towards the economic expenses of her home. Also, she counts on the support of her husband, who is a teacher. She has been a part of the communal bank "Las Lomas de Yarina" for eight years. The first credit she received was 300 soles, which she invested in the purchase of blouses and polo shirts to sell them to her clients. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 soles, which will be used to purchase womens', mens', and childrens' clothing. Greisi's goal is to have a small market in her house and also to sell footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase womens', mens', and childrens' clothing

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
La señorita Milagros es socia del  Banco Comunal “30 de Agosto”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 28 años de edad y es  soltera. Se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes y frutas.

La señorita Milagros tiene grado de instrucción superior completa y no tiene hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años atrás.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de frutas como: naranja, manzana, plátano, etc.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de abarrotes como: fideos, arroz, azúcar, etc.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Milagros is a partner of the communal bank "30 de Agosto" and lives in the district of Llave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 28 years old and single. Milagros has a degree in secondary education and does not have any children. She makes a living by selling groceries and fruit. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years now. Her first loan was 500 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase fruits, such as: oranges, apples, plantains, etc. This time she requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles, which she will invest in the purchase of groceries, such as: noodles, rice, sugar, etc. Her desire for the future is to have a grocery store. The thing she likes most about her communal bank is the savings it provides her.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, etc. for her business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente. Se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.

La señora Yolanda tiene estudios de primaria completa y tiene 1 hijo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 meses atrás.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales menores.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de ganado: ovejas.

Su deseo para el futuro es comprar una casa para ella y su hijo.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización son las reuniones y los ahorros que gana.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a partner of the communal bank "Manuelas de hoy II" and lives in the district of Llave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 24 years old and is a live-in partner. She has completed elementary education and has one son. She makes a living by purchasing and selling small animals. Yolanda has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four months now. Her first loan was 500 nuevos soles, which she used to buy small animals. Now she is requesting another loan of 500 nuevos soles, which she will invest in the purchase of livestock, such as sheep. Her desire for the future is to buy a house for herself and her son. The things she likes most about her organization are the meetings and the savings she earns.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Juntos Trabajando Group

texts.es:
EMPRENDEDORES Y TRABAJADORES, ELLOS VIVEN EN LAZONA D. AÑO NUEVO EN ELDISTRITO D. COMAS.
NIRA , INTEGRA ÉSTE GRUPO DESD. HACE TRES AÑOS, TIENE 66 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES VIUDAD Y TIENE 8 HIJOS TODOS MAYORES D. EDAD QUE LA APOYAN EN SUS PROYECTOS.
ELLA SE DEDICA HACE APROXIMADAMENTE 15 AÑOS S LA VENTA D. COMIDA RÁPIDA, EN UN CARRITO SANGUCHERO QUE LO UBICA TODAS LAS NOCHES EN LA PUERTA D. SU CASA.
INICIÓ SU NEGOCIO D. POCO EN POCO, CON LA IDEA D. APOYAR EN LOS GASTOS D. LA CASA, SIN TENER QUE DESCUIDAR A SUS MENORES HIJOS, ES POR ESO QUE CON LOS AHORROS QUE PUDO JUNTAR COMPRÓ SU CARRITO SANGUCHERO Y EMPEZÓ A TRABAJAR, LUEGO D. UNOS MESES PUCO IMPLEMENTAR UN ESPACIO EN SU CASA PARA COLOCAR MESAS Y PODER ATENDER CON MAS COMODIDAD A SUS CLIENTES.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO PAGAR LOS ESTUDIOS D. SUS NIETAS QUE ESTUDIAN EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, Y ASI DAR EL EJEMPLO A SUS HIJAS DEL TRABAJO Y ENSEÑAR FUNCIONAMIENTO DEL NEGOCIO.
LE AGRADARÍA MUCHO PONER UN RESTAURANTE  E INGRESAR AL NEGOCIO D. LA VENTA D. ALMUERZOS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO DESTINARÁ A LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS ALPOR MAYOR,  PARA SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Entrepreneurs and workers, they live in the Año Nuevo region in the Comas district. Nira has been a member of this group for three years. She is a 66 year old widow, and she has eight adult children who support her in her projects. For approximately 15 years she has been selling fast food. She sells from a street cart, which she places in the door to her house every night. She started her business little by little with the idea of helping with the household expenses without having to neglect her minor children. With the savings she was able to get together, she bought her street cart and started to work. Then, in a few months she was able to set up a space in her house to put tables. That way she could wait on her customers more comfortably. With her work she has been able to pay for her granddaughters’ university education. This way she sets a work example for her daughters, and she teaches them how the business works. It would really please her to set up a restaurant and start the business of selling lunches. The loan she is asking for is to buy supplies wholesale for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Luisa De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Luisa de los Ángeles G. O. es una joven de 24 años de edad emprendedora de un negocio de tortillas el cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$2000.00 que le dio su esposo hace 5 años. Este negocio está ubicado en el Barrio la URSS, al este de la capital Managua. 

Ella se levanta a palmear con su mamá a las 4:00 am de la mañana para  terminar de palmear la primera ronda de tortillas a las 8:00 am mañana estas tortillas las termina de vender hasta la una de la tarde cuyo costo es de C$ 1:00. Y la segunda ronda comienza a las 2:00pm y termina a las 6:00 pm de la tarde. A la par de las tortillas también vende cuajaditas a C$1.00 y frijoles cocidos C$5.00.

Los insumos que ella utiliza son Leña a un costo de C$120.00 las 60 rajas, Maseca a C$155 las 25 libras o arroba, y los frijoles a C$ 8.00 la libra.

El crédito lo solicita para reparar el techo de su cocina que tiene 6 láminas de Zinc en mal estado, unos cuartones (vigas), y el restante es para invertir en la compra de insumos del negocio.

Actualmente el negocio se encuentra en el patio de su casa; el contorno de la cocina es de puro zinc, con piso de suelo, un fogón tradicional, una ventana y una mesa de madera con un área de 4 metros cuadrados.

Ella es casada, con 5 hijos a su cargo 3 de ellos en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella vendía ambulante Posol y tiste, y ahora está agradecida con CEPRODEL porque tiene mejores condiciones en su cocina, vende más tortillas, ya que no tiene que dejar de trabajar cuando llueve.
texts.en:
Luisa de los Ángeles G. O., 24, is a tortilla merchant. She began her work with an initial investment of 2000 colones she got from her husband 5 years ago. The tortilla shop is located in the URSS neighborhood in the eastern part of Managua. She and her mother get up at 4am to start making the tortillas so that they can have the first batch done by 8am. These tortillas will be sold by 1pm and she charges 1 colon. The second batch is started at 2pm and ends at 6pm. Besides the tortillas, she also sells cuajaditas (a local cheese) for 1 colon and cooked beans, for 5 colones. The raw materials she consumes are: firewood, which costs 120 colones for 60 pieces, Maseca (corn meal) at 155 colones for 25 pounds, and beans, at 8 colones per pound. The financing is to repair her kitchen's roof which has 6 zinc metal sheets in very poor condition, and some wood beams; the remainder is to buy raw materials for the tortillas. Currently, the shop is in her yard. The kitchen's walls are all zinc metal, it has a dirt floor, a traditional firepit, a window, and a wood table that measures 4 square meters. She is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom are school age and still under her care. She states that, before having her tortilla shop, she was a street vendor of posol (a corn drink) and tiste (a cactus fruit blended with lime and sugar, has a dark purple color and seedy pulp) and now she is grateful to CEPRODEL because she has a better kitchen, sells more tortillas, and doesn't have to stop working when it rains.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her kitchen's roof and purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señorita Marina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo , provincia de El Collao; ella tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos. Estudió primaria completa.
Marina trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de queso y pescado
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró queso y pescado.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en la compra de papa, queso, pescado y pan..
Su visión hacia el futuro es trabajar mas en su negocio, tener otros negocios como venta de chompas y otros.
Lo que mas le gusta de su banco comunal son las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Ms. Marina is a member of the "Las Brisas del Río Blanco" [Breezes of the Blanco River] Community Bank in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province. She is 27 years old, single, and does not have any children. She finished elementary school. Marina has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four years and buys and sells cheese and fish. She tells us that with her first loan of 300 PEN, she bought cheese and fish.

She is asking for a loan of 2500 PEN, which she will use to buy potatoes, cheese, fish, and bread. Her vision for the future is to work more at her business, and to have other businesses such as selling sweaters and other things. What she likes best about her community bank are the meetings and the seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese, potatoes, bread, fish, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita G. es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 28 años, es soltera, ella se esfuerza por salir adelante.
Margarita se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y néctar al por menor, ella se esfuerza a diario para ampliar su negocio. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de gaseosas para vender en su casa. Ahora Margarita necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que será utilizado en la compra de bebidas refrescantes para vender. La meta de Margarita es  tener una tienda de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Margarita G. is a hard-working and active woman. She lives in Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 28 years old, single, and works hard to get ahead in life. Margarita sells soft drinks and juice nectars at retail, and strives daily to expand her business. She has been a member of the "Las Divinas" Community Bank for two years. The first loan she received was 300 PEN, which she used to buy soft drinks to sell from her home. Now Margarita needs a loan of 1200 PEN that she will use to buy soft drinks to sell. Margarita's goal is to have a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks at wholesale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa.

La señora Elsa  estudió primaria completa y tiene 1  hijo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años atrás.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ropa y así aumentar su mercadería.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de ropa para aumentar su capital en su negocio.

Su deseo para el futuro es abrir una tienda de ropa en Ilave y así obtener mayores ganancias.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización es el ahorro y las reuniones que se dan.
texts.en:
Elsa, 40, is married and the mother of one son. She finished elementary school. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a member of the "24 de Junio" communal bank and sells clothing. She has been associated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 2 years. Her initial, 300 sol, loan was used to buy clothing to increase her stock. She is now requesting 800 new soles to buy clothing to increase her working capital. Her wish for the future is to have a clothing store in Ilave to obtain higher profits. What she likes most about her organization is the savings and the meetings they have.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
La señora Albina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, vive en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 48 años de edad y es madre soltera. Se dedica a la loseria. 

El grado de instrucción de la señora Albina es primaria completa y tiene 2 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 años atrás.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ollas, platos, tazas, etc.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra  de ollas, platos, tazas, servicios, etc.

Su deseo para el futuro es comprarse un terreno y techarlo.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Ms. Albina is a member of the Village Bank "Señor de la Justicia". She lives in Puno, is 48 years old, has two children and is a single mother. Ms. Albina earns a living selling crockery. She is very fond of the Village Bank's savings accounts and their meetings. As for her educational background, she completed primary school. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one year now. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 new soles, which helped her to purchase pots, plates, cups, etc. She is requesting a loan of S/. 1,200.00 new soles, which she will invest in the purchase of pots, plates, cups, silverware, etc. It is her wish that in the future she be able to purchase a plot of land and build on it.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Mulligan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cups, plates, pots, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es una socia activa y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre de un hijo mayor de edad, ella se dedica a la costura, confección de todo tipo de prendas de vestir, para ello cuenta con un pequeño taller.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es profesor en una institución. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “De la Amistad” desde hace once años, tiempo que a pesar de haber tenido algunas dificultades, siempre se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad, ella esta contenta de ser parte del Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque le permite seguir adelante en su negocio. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de hilos, elasticos, blondas, etc,para realizar sus confecciones. En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 500 soles que será utilizado en la compra de telas. La meta de Rita es tener un taller mas amplio de costura  y una vitrina para colocar sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Rita is an active and collaborative businesswoman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the region of Ucayali. She is 50 years old and mother of a grown son. She works as a seamstress, tailoring all types of clothing. To do this, Rita has a small workshop.

Rita has the support of her husband who is a teacher for an institution. Rita has been a member of the communal bank "De la Amistad" for the past 11 years, during which time, in spite of some difficulties, she has always been punctual. She is happy to be part of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (the Manuela Ramos Movement) because it allows her to progress with her business. To continue with her tailoring business, Rita invested her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles in to the purchase of thread, elastic, silk lace, etc. She currently needs a loan of 500 Peruvian soles, which will be used to buy fabric. Rita's goal is to have a bigger sewing workshop and a showcase in which to hang her clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Lola Maqueda

texts.es:
La señora LOLA MAQUEDA, tiene  43 años, vive en el distrito Huanchaco de la provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal FUENTE DE VIDA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria. La socia se dedica  a la venta de gas.
