Con sus primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró balones de gas al por mayor.
Con su próximo crédito de 2,800 nuevos soles comprará gas y una parte la utilizará para sembrar alfalfa en las chacras que tiene en la sierra.
La señora Lola sueña con aumentar sus ventas de gas.
texts.en:
Lola Maqueda is 43 years old and lives in the village of Huanchaco in Trujillo province, in the La Libertad region of Peru. Lola is member of the community bank Fuente de Vida. She is educated to fifth grade of secondary school. Lola sells gas cylinders.

Lola used her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles to buy gas cylinders in bulk.

With her next loan of 2,800 Peruvian soles, Lola wants to buy more gas, some of which she'll use to sow alfalfa in the small allotments she has in the mountains.

Lola dreams of growing her gas selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tanks of gas wholesale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 34 años de edad y está casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
La señora tiene estudios no concluidos de primaria y en su poder aun tiene a 4 hijos.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 2 años atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ganado.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de ganado: oveja, toro.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una casa en Ilave.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización son las reuniones
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the 24 de Junio Communal Bank. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 34 and married. She buys and sells livestock. She did not complete elementary school, and she is raising four children. She has worked with the Manuela R. Movement for two years. Her first loan in her communal bank was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy livestock. She is asking for a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy livestock, sheep and a bull. Her wish for the future is to have a house in Ilave. What she likes most about her organization are the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and pigs

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Juntos Podemos (Together We Can), are clients of Asociación Arariwa.  This communal bank consists of 13 members in Cusco.  There are 10 women and 3 men. All the group members live in Santiago and San Sebastian, which are neighborhoods in Cusco.  Some are married with kids while others are single.

The members of Juntos Podemos are involved in various commercial activities, including selling foodstuff such as potatoes and fruit as well as artesanía.  One of the members, Xiomara, was born in Cusco and lives in San Sebastian.  She is 35 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Together with her family she sells fruit in the Mercado Ferial (weekly market), in San Sebastian, and has been doing so for 13 years, since she was a little girl.  She sells approximately 3,200 soles per month, which is the equivalent of $1100.  She will invest in buying more fruit to sell.

All of the members of Juntos Podemos appreciate and thank you for the loan and promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Business capital such as buying more fruit to sell

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor Manuel García M. , desde hace quince años labora como guarda de seguridad en una casa privada , su planes futuros es poder mejorar la vivienda ya que en los tiempos de lluvia se le pasa el agua , por el mal estado del techo y poder ver terminada su casa ya que le hace falta la gran parte de la construcción y por sus ingresos no ha podido realizar la obra , con el préstamo va a invertirlo en materiales de construcción para poder mejorar su calidad de vida , don Víctor habita en un barrio del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica , ellos tiene dos hijos de doce y cincos años , los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar a sus hijos es sus estudios para que sean hombres de bien . Agradece a la institución por la confianza que le brinda con este primer crédito ya que son muchas las familias que se benefician y logran sus metas a pesar de la situación económica por la cual enfrenta el país.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel García M. has worked as a security guard in a private home for the past 15 years. His plans for the future are to fix his house because, during the rainy season, thanks to the poor condition of the roof, it leaks. He would like to see his house finished but, because of his low income, he hasn't been able to complete construction. With this financing he will buy building materials so that he can improve his quality of life. He lives in a neighborhood in Ticuantepe with his wife, who works as a domestic, and their two sons, who are 12 and 5 years old, respectively. He hopes to help his sons with their education so that they will grow into responsible adults. He thanks the institution for the trust placed in him with this first loan since many families are benefitted and reach their goals despite the economic situation the country is facing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.es: Lulu es una mujer dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali, tiene 53 años, es madre de seis hijos todos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a dar servicio de alquiler de motokar, actividad  que comparte con su esposo. Ella esta contenta por formar parte del Banco Comunal “Las Lomas de Yarina” desde hace nueve años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que fue utilizado para comprar un nintendo para alquilar, este negocio funciona en su casa (video juego). Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar repuestos y dar mantenimiento a sus dos motocarros.  Estos vehículos generan ingresos económicos a su hogar porque ella los alquila. La meta de Lulu es tener una tienda de repuestos y accesorios de motos y motocarros.
texts.en:
Lulu is a dynamic woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucayali region. She is 53, and she has six grown children. She provides the service of renting out “motocarros” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). She and her husband share this activity. She is happy to be part of the Las Lomas de Yarina Communal Bank. She has belonged for nine years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy a Nintendo to rent. This business is in her house (video games). She now needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy replacement parts and give maintenance to her two motocarros. These vehicles generate income for her household because she rents them. Lulu’s goal is to have a replacement parts and accessories store for motorcycles and motocarros.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacement parts and maintenance for her two motocarros

loans.name: Rita Lorena

texts.es: La Señora Rita C. de 51 años de edad, con más de 10 años de experiencia en la elaboración de repostería y bocadillo, siendo el medio de trabajo con el cual ha salido poco a poco adelante con sus hijos. Al tener conocimiento de repostería ella se ha dedicado a vender por encargos y al público en general su producto gusta a los clientes. Lo inicio con mucho esfuerzo ya que era del poco ingreso que recibía, ella instalo su venta de torta a las ventas del alrededor y vecinos, se requería de financiamiento para ir mejorando el ambiente empresarial que se estaba iniciando, a este tiempo el negocio ha dado giros diferentes de beneficio para la familia ya que ha crecido, estableciendo su productos en colegios y cafetines. Esto implica cambios en los materiales que se utilizan y la comodidad del negocio. Este es el segundo ciclo de financiamiento con el cuales lo invertirá en pequeñas remodelación de la casa para mayor comodidad de su negocio y familia. Con la compra de materiales de construcción como: perlines, zinc, clavos y reglones para cambiar y levantar el techo de la sala. Evitando que se le presente ambiente de robo y perdidas que causaran daños a al negocio y a su vida.
texts.en:
Señora Rita C., 51, has been a pastry and snack merchant for over 10 years. This work has allowed her to see her children get ahead in life little by little. Having pastry-making skills, she began selling based on prior orders and directly to the public; her products are well-liked by her customers. She began it with a lot of effort because her earnings were very low. She began selling her cakes to her neighbors and in areas near her home. She needed financing to continue to improve the business she was starting. Her business has grown and gone through some changes over time that have benefitted her family, like supplying her products to schools and cafes. This requires a change in the materials that are used and the comfort of the business. This is her second financing cycle and she will use the funds for small remodeling projects in her house to increase the comfort level for her family and for her business. WIth the purchase of building materials like zinc and metal sheeting, nails, edgings, she will change and improve the roof on the living room avoiding being exposed to the danger of burglary and losses that could damage her business or her life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to build a roof.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del  Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 43 años de edad y es madre soltera. tiene una tienda de abarrotes. 

El grado de instrucción de la señora Rosa es secundaria  completa, tiene 2 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para invertirlo en su tienda.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener un locutorio, y una tienda donde pueda vender artefactos electrodomésticos.  Su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros que gana , las reuniones y la puntualidad de las socias.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 3 de Mayo Communal Bank. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a 43 year old single mother. She has a grocery store. She completed high school, and she has two children. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to invest in her store. She is asking for a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy groceries like sugar, rice, and noodles, etc. Her wish for the future is to have a telephone booth and a store where she could sell electro domestic appliances. Her biggest wish is that her children become professionals. What she likes most about her communal bank are the savings that she gets, the meetings, and the punctuality of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar, etc.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La señora Felicitas es socia del  Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, vive en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 80 años de edad y es conviviente. Tiene su tienda donde vende todo tipo de productos. 

El grado de instrucción de la señora Felicitas es secundaria completa y tiene 1 hija.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de  abarrotes.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc..

Su deseo para el futuro es vivir feliz sin preocupaciones.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicitas is a member of the “Señor de la Justicia” Communal Bank. She lives in the district of Puno, province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 80 years old and lives with her partner. Felicitas has her own store where she sells all types of products.

She completed her secondary studies and has one daughter.

Felicitas works with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos since 4 years ago. Her first loan was of S/.300.00 nuevos soles, that helped her buy groceries.

She needs a loan of S/.800.00 nuevos soles that will be invested to buy rice, sugar, spaghetti, etc.

Her wish for the future is to live a happy life without any worries.

What Felicitas enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, spaghetti, etc.

loans.name: Andrea Justina

texts.es:
La señora Andrea M. se dedica arduamente al negocio de venta de ropa la que atiende en el departamento de León en el mercado la Terminal ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y por lograr mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel porque necesita invertir en la compra de la ropa para continuar comercializándola. Es importante destacar que ella inicia sus ventas desde las cinco de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde todos los días por lo que es una dama muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Andrea M. is conscientiously dedicated to selling clothing in a stall located in the Terminal market in the department of León. She stocks all types of clothing for women, gentlemen and children. She has stood out for being very hard-working and for managing to improve her living conditions. She has called upon Ceprodel because she needs to invest in clothing to add to her stock. It is important to stress that she starts selling at 5am and continues on to 5pm every day; she is a very hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Maria Urora

texts.es:
La señora   MARIA URORA M. M. , tiene  42 años, vive en el distrito de  MOCHE provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria y  tiene 3 hijas todas pequeñas y  dependen económicamente de ella .La socia se dedica a la crianza de patos, pollos y chanchos y con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compro patos bebes para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos.
Con este crédito de 400.00 nuevos soles comprará pollos bebes doble pechuga para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos vivos o por kilos en el mercado cercano a su casa.
Ella sueña con tener su granja de pollos para así generar mayores ganancias y poder brindarles una mejor educación y calidad de vida a sus menores hijas.
texts.en:
María Urora M. Martínez is 42. She lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Siempre Adelante II Communal Bank. She attened school until her fifth year of high school. She has three small daughters who are economically dependent upon her. She raises ducks, chickens and pigs. She used her first loan for 300 PEN to buy baby ducks to raise and later sell. With this loan for 400 PEN she will by double breasted baby chickens. She will raise them and sell them live or by kilos in the market close to her house. She dreams of having a chicken farm in order to generate greater earnings. That way she will be able to give her daughters a better education and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy double breasted baby chickens

loans.name: Nieves María

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Nieves S. se dedica muy arduamente a su actividad veterinaria donde oferta todo tipo de medicamentos para animales comercializados a diario por ella misma desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.
Ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y hoy en día ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para invertirlo en la compra de los medicamentos para animales con el fin de ofertarlos en su veterinaria y de esta manera continuar mejorando las condiciones de su actividad y por ende la de su familia en el departamento de León.
texts.en:
Nieves S. works arduously as a veterinarian in the León department. She offers all types of medication for animals. She sells them herself every day from very early in the morning until the late afternoon. She stands out as being a very hard-working person. She is now asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy the medications for animals to be able to sell them in her veterinary business. This way she will continue to improve her work conditions and, therefore, her family’s condition in the León department.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medication for her veterinary business

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Eva Mercedes H. con mucho esfuerzo se ha dedicado a atender su propia pulpería la que posee desde hace nueve años siendo esta la que le permite obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos de pulpería como lo son los comestibles tales como golosinas, galletas y otros y también lo utilizará para la compra de periódicos porque también los vende en su localidad. Con este crédito se beneficiará grandemente y logrará mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Eva Mercedes H. lives in the department of León, where she has run a small grocery store for the past 9 years, that has produced earnings to benefit her family. She requests funding to buy stock items for her store like: sweets, cookies and others as well as newspapers that she also stocks. This loan will greatly benefit her because it will allow her to improve the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy store stock items and newspapers.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
La Señora Sandra Alemán, a sus 52 años de edad, casada y habitante de un barrio de la capital tiene como objetivo principal mejorar su vivienda para seguridad. Como mujer a cumplido sus metas de tener sus propio negocio de ventas de joyas, es de beneficio económico siendo un ingreso 
mas a la casa, se le ha presentado diversas dificultades como las ventas baja de unos meses atrás, la que generaron una desnivelación de sus ingresos, con el apoyo de su esposo han ido poco a poco mejorando su nivel de vida. Tiene como planes futuros establecer una librería en la cual su hija sea la responsable y continúe las mejoras. Con el financiamiento que le hemos ofrecido ha ido remodelando y construyendo parte por parte su vivienda, cambiando el techo, construyendo el muro de la parte izquierda, el corredor y ahora el préstamo será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, cerámica, continuando con el mejoramiento del corredor colocado cerámica, contribuyendo a que el ser humano tenga mejor desplazamiento dentro de su casa. No corriendo peligro ya que el corredor será mas seguro para todos y evitando enfermedades en mejorar la higiene con el piso.
texts.en:
Sandra Alemán, 52, married and living in a neighborhood in the capital, has as her main goal improving her home for better security. As a woman, she has met her goal of having her own jewelry sale business. This is an economic benefit for the family in that it produces additional income for them. She has faced various difficulties such as low sales the past few months which caused her income to fall out of balance with her expenses. However, with her husband's help, she has managed to improve her status bit by bit. Her future plans include setting up a bookstore that her daughter will manage and to continue with home improvements. With the funding offered this time she has been remodeling and building her house bit by bit, replacing the roof, building a wall on the left side, the hallway. Now she will buy building materials, like cement and ceramic tile, to continue with the hallway by laying tile so that the human beings in the house can have improved mobility in it and not being in danger since the hallway will be safer for all and avoiding illnesses by improving hygiene with a new floor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and ceramic tile.

loans.name: Aura Nohemi

texts.es:
La Señora Aura Nohemí S. O., labora como aseadora en la Unidad de Intendencia de la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua ( UNAN ), ella tiene a su cargo dos hijos, estos se encuentran en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en ese lapso ha invertido  cuatros créditos en la mejorar de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, ella es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del piso de la vivienda en que habita y el pago de la mano obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura Nohemí S. O. works as a cleaning lady in the administrative offices of the the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua (UNAN). She is a single mother of two school-age children who has had four loans with CEPRODEL in the past three years. She has invested this money in home improvements authorized by CEPRODEL. She is an excellent customer. This loan is to invest in purchasing materials to remodel the floor in her home and to pay for the labor -- to give her children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to change her home's floor.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie G. is from the town of Calamba. She is 33 years old, is married, and has a baby. Lanie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is just starting this business. Lanie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Santiago Apostol Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTIAGO APOSTOL”. Este banco comunal está conformado por 10 miembros, ellos se reúnen una vez al mes en el local principal de La Asociación Arariwa.  

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio minorista en la ciudad del Cusco, una gran parte se dedica a la venta de libros y de ropa para niños en el centro comercial “El Paraíso”. La socia Deisi se dedica a la venta de artesanía como collares huacos retratos y mantos. Los socios Daniel, Ana y Margot se dedican a la venta de libros, revistas, cuentos y enciclopedias. La socia Isabel trabaja en un programa de educación inicial de niños. Ya son varios años que trabajan en sus negocios y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo, nuestros socios son personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que quiere sacar adelante a su familia.

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital de trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “Santiago Apóstol” communal bank. This communal bank is made up of 10 members. They meet once per month in the main offices of the Arawia Association [Kiva Field Partner]. Our members alternate their various economic activities with working in retail. A number of them sell books and children’s clothing in the “El Paraiso” shopping center. Deisi sells crafts such as necklaces, pottery, and blankets. Daniel, Ana, and Margo sell books, magazines, short stories, and encyclopedias. Isabel works in an early child education program. They have worked in their businesses for several years and things have gone well for them because of the determined effort they put into their work. Our members are hardworking and entrepreneurial people who want to provide a better future for their families. The members are requesting a loan to use as working capital so that they can increase their stocks of merchandise and thereby increase their sales. They want to provide a better quality of life for their families. The members value and appreciate the loan that is granted through this organization and they are committed to repaying during the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use as working capital so that they can increase their stocks of merchandise and thereby increase their sales.

loans.name: Lionardo Yvan

texts.es:
El Señor Lionardo Yvan Méndez Palacios, Labora como colector de Ruta del Mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua, el tiene a su cargo dos hijos, se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en ese lapso ha invertido  15 créditos en la mejorar de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, ella es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo de la vivienda y el pago de la mano obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Lionardo Yvan Méndez Palacios works as a custodian at the Roberto Huembés Market in Managua. He cares for his two school-aged children, is married, and has worked with Ceprodel for seven years. In this time, he has invested fifteen credits in making improvements to his home, and he is an excellent client. He will invest the credit requested in the purchase of materials to remodel his roof and to pay for labor to give his children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for construction materials to remodel the roof on his house.

loans.name: Santa Barbara Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Santa Barbara (which is the name of a virgin), are clients of Asociación Arariwa. This communal bank consists of 10 members in Cusco. All the group members live in Poroy, which is a neighborhood in Cusco. All of the members live with their common-law spouse and have children. The members of Santa Barbara are involved in various commercial activities, including selling fruits, artesanía (hand crafts), and construction materials.

One of the members, Claudio Francisco, was born in Cusco, and lives in Poroy. He is 38 years old. He lives with his partner and has 3 children. He sells construction materials for homes, mostly wood. He sells 1,800 soles per week, which is the equivalent of $620. He earns about 4,380 soles per month. With this loan, he will invest in his construction business.

All of the members of Santa Barbara appreciate and thank you for the loan and promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

(Cristobal is not pictured in the photo.)

loans.use: Capital for businesss capital, for example, for material for construction business

loans.name: Kancharisun Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “KANCHARISUN”. El nombre del banco comunal es D. origen del Quechua que traducido al español significa “iluminemos”. Este banco comunal está conformado por 16 miembros, ellos se reúnen una vez al mes en el local principal D. La Asociación Arariwa.  

Apolinaria tiene un puesto D. negocio donD. venD. ricos jugos D. varias frutas como jugo D. papaya, jugo plátanos, etc. Las socias Elizabeth, Lelia, Maria Laura y MatilD. se dedican a la enseñanza en diversos colegios del Cusco, ellas se esfuerzan por aprender a usar las tecnologías D. la información para enseñar a sus alumnos. La socia Manuela es asistente D. administración en la municipalidad del distrito D. San Sebastián. Otra D. nuestras socias se dedica a la venta D. artesanías como huacos retratos, collares, adornos con las características del Cusco y muchas cosas más. La socia Martha tiene 36 años es coordinadora del vaso D. leche. El programa social D. vaso D. leche es para apoyar a mujeres D. bajos recursos económicos, Nuestra socia Martha es casada y tiene un hijo y comprenD. lo muy trabajoso que es tener un hijo y educarlo y por eso ayuda en el programa social. Los otros socios trabajan haciendo servicio D. transportes y vendiendo juguetes en la ferias dominicales del Cusco. 

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital D. trabajo y asi D. esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the KANCHARISUN Communal Bank. This Quechuan name of the bank is translated in Spanish as “iluminemos” (Light Givers). This bank is composed of 16 members and they meet once a month at the main office of La Asociación Arariwa (The Arariwa Association). Apolinaria has a stand where she sells a variety of wonderful fruit juices, such as papaya juice, plantain juice, etc. The members Elizabeth, Lelia, Maria Laura and MatilD. work at teaching in various schools in Cuzco. They are working to learn to use information technology in order to teach their students. Our member Manuela is an administrative assistant for the municipality of the District of San Sebastian. Others of our members work at selling handicrafts such as portraiture pottery, necklaces and ornaments characteristic of Cuzco, and many other things. Our member Martha is 36 years old and is the coordinator for Vaso D. Leche (Glass of Milk). This social assistance program provides support to women of low economic resources. Martha is married and has a son, and she understands what hard work it is to have a child and to educate him. That's why she assists with this social program. The other members are working at transportation services and selling toys at the Sunday Fairs in Cuzco. The members are requesting this loan for their use as working capital in order to increase their products and also their sales, so that they can proviD. a better quality of life for their families. The members value and appreciate the loan bestowed by this means, and at the same time they promise to comply with the installment payments according to the established plan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise or for personal use.

loans.name: Madres Unidas De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
MADRES UNIDAS DE YANACOTO

Esta alcancía comunal se inició hace 3 años, son 11 personas quienes integran los cuales son microempresarios muy trabajadores, buscan a través de sus negocios mejorar su condición de vida económica a fin de darles a los suyos lo mejor cada día. Así tenemos el caso de María Rita: Tengo 52 años, casada y madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, me inicié como microempresaria más de quince años porque veía que el sueldo de mi esposo no era lo suficiente para mejorar nuestra casita de esteras y calaminas, como también comprar algunas cosas para el hogar. Vendía kerosene en mi casa, daba pensión, limpiaba en casas, luego hacía gelatinas, chupetes de frutas; siempre tuve el apoyo de mi esposo.
Llegó el tiempo que decidí plantar una pequeña tiendita para ello compré media y un cuarto de cada cosita (arroz, azúcar, huevos, fideos, papa, aceite, leche, detergente u otros) invertía las ganancias en implementar cada vez más mi negocio. Hoy en día mi bodeda es una de las más surtida de la zona donde vivo, esto me ayudó a construir de material noble mi casa, ayudar a mi madre, darle educación superior (policía) a mi hijo y solventar en algunos gastos. Requiero del préstamo para adquirir mercadería en detergente, arroz, azúcar y esta manera seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Madres Unidas de Yanacoto This communal bank started three years ago. There are 11 members. They are very hard-working small business owners who look to improve the condition of their economic lives through their businesses. They do this to give their families the best every day. Here is María Rita’s case. I am 52, married, and have two adult children. I started as a small businesswoman over 15 years ago because I saw that my husband’s salary was not enough to improve our house made of reeds and corrugated metal or to buy things for the house. I sold kerosene from my house, I boarded people, I cleaned houses, and I then sold gelatin and fruit lollipops. I always had my husband’s support. The time came when I decided to establish a small store. To do this I bought a little bit of each thing (rice, sugar, eggs, noodles, potatoes, oil, milk, detergent, and others). I invested the earnings each time in setting up the store more. Now, my store is one of the best stocked in the area where I live. This helped me build my house from strong material, help my mother, give my son a post high school education (police), and pay other expenses. I need the loan to get merchandise like detergent, rice, and sugar. This way I will keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim S. is a 33-year-old married woman and is blessed with three children who are teenagers. She currently stays at home to sell a few produce items in her small store in front of her home. 

Her husband is a domestic construction foreman, who has employees to provide his service. Kim S.'s husband has been very busy at his business due to there being many clients who need him to build their houses, but he is  lacking material for construction. That is why Kim S. requested her second loan for capital to buy extra construction materials.

loans.use: To buy extra construction materials

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem P., 27, is a humble villager who lives in Reusey Keo commune, in Phnom Penh city. She works as a teacher at the local public school and typically earns a salary of $120 a month to help provide her family’s food needs. She is a single woman and currently lives with her young sister, who works as a Civil Service officer for a ministry.

Hem P. has been planning to operate a café business for years, but she doesn’t have enough money to start it. That is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva through HKL. She will be use her loan to build a shop in front of her home where she will operate a café.

loans.use: To build a café in front of her home

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria T. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Gloria owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional pig feed. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Kub

texts.en:
Kub M. is 23 years old and lives with her own family in Phnom Penh city. She is a good housewife who cooks delicious meals for her family. To earn a living, she sells some clothes and fake jewelry in the local market, where she can make income of around $6 per day to feed her family.

Kub M. is a single woman who has two siblings who are students who also help sell her inventory when they are not going to school. Kub M. currently resides with her mother who helps do all the housework. Kub M. was busy at her business when the photo taken, so her mother is pictured instead.

In the past, Kub M. rented a market shop for her business and right now she hopes to own her shop by using a Kiva loan to buy one. The loan will help her to cut her rental costs.

loans.use: To buy a shop for her business

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en:
G. Tserendolgor is 49 years old and lives with his wife in Uvurhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He and his wife have one daughter and she is 26 years old and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. G. owns a motorcycle which he uses as a taxi at the local market. Since his motorcycle is cheaper than a taxicab, those who are going home from the market with bags of stuff like to use his motorcycle. When he has more time, he also retails cattle skins and sheepskins. He purchases animal skins from the herder families and resells them at the market for a profit. G.'s wife makes traditional clothes at home. She is a talented sewer and has been making traditional clothes for locals for many years. G. says that he works hard with his wife to send some money for their only daughter who lives in the capital city. They want her to purchase her own piece of land where she can reside in the city. G. requests a loan to purchase more animal skins for his business. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more animal skins to sell

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon E. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old and is married. Ramon owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, canned goods, etc., in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ramon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en:
Ankhbayar is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son, 8, attends a local secondary school and his daughter, 3, attends kindergarten. Ankhbayar operates both a taxi service and a fitness club in his town. He began his taxi service in 2008 after managing a clothing retail business for two years. He then opened his fitness club in order to supplement the family’s earnings. He hopes to expand both of his businesses in the future. He says, “I am working hard to improve my businesses and educate my children.” Ankhbayar is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase equipment for his fitness club. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his fitness club

loans.name: Chourn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chourn R., 24, is married to Mr. Yeun Sophorn, age 25, who appears in the photo. This couple has three kids who attend school.

Chourn R. is a garment factory worker who provides her salary to help meet her family’s financial crisis. Her husband catches fish to earn a living. Chourn R. is taking out her loan to purchase more fishing equipment for her husband to fish with.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing equipment for her husband to fish with

loans.name: Uon

texts.en: Uon M., 35, is a hard-working woman who lives in Phnom Penh city, where she makes a living selling cakes in front of a garment factory. Her husband contributes to the family's income by driving a motorbike taxi. The couple has two children, both of them in school. In Cambodia, this is the time of year when fish are in abundant supply and prices are especially low, so Uon is applying for this loan to buy a large amount of fish to turn into paste to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk to turn into paste to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar H. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two teenage boys in Hovd, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His boys are 9 and 10 years old and go to a local secondary school. Ulambayar runs a small retail business selling meat. He rents a stall at the local food market, where he sells mostly mutton and beef. He buys cattle and sheep from local herders, and slaughters and sells their meat in small pieces. He also owns a small car that he uses as a taxi in the evening. This car helps him earn some extra income for his family. He works very hard and is committed to trying different types of businesses to earn money for his family and increase its well-being. He has applied for this loan to buy cattle and sheep for his business. 

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan with Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to buy cattle and sheep

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en:
Enhtaivan B. is 56 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Hovd, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His children are all grown, and their ages range from 17 to 23. He owns an old car that he uses as a taxi. Since there is no public transportation in his area, business is good. Enhtaivan has been driving this cab since 2006, with help from his sons, one of whom also handles repairs. Enhtaivan has applied for this loan to buy new tires for his vehicle. 


About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to buy new tires for his car

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long S., age 49, is a widow who works very hard to earn money for her family. She makes a living selling various kinds of fruits in a local market. She also sells beef soup from her home after she finishes selling fruit, and earns $5 a day from her work. Long S. receives help from her daughter, and is committed to make her business more successful and increase her income, She is applying for this loan to buy additional supplies and ingredients to sell to her customers

loans.use: To expand her business and make it more efficient and stable

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie M. lives in Silanga Tangub City. She is 48 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She makes a living by raising fish for sale. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Virgie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans from GDMPC, and has applied for a new loan to repair a vehicle she uses in her work. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Аhhoyan

texts.en:
Ahhoyon R. is 57 yeas old and lives with her husband and four children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Her oldest daughter is 20 years old and goes to a local university and the other three children are all high school students.

Ahhoyon has been active in her meat retail business since 2002, selling mutton and beef at the local market with her husband. She mostly purchases cattle and sheep carcasses from herder families in the countryside at discount and then sells them in small pieces at the local food market. As she has been in the business for quite some time, she has got a number of customers who always purchase meat from her.

Ahhoyon says that she would like to expand her business as much as possible. She requests a loan to purchase more mutton and beef for her business.


About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
 To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
 To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more mutton and beef

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza M. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Liza owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 900 PHP a month. In 2008, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Froilan

texts.en:
Froilan P. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Froilan owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Froilan has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2009, Froilan joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Froilan is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Phoeung

texts.en: Phoeung Y., 36, has been selling fresh fish in the village for years and also provides small loans with specific repayment schedules to her neighbors to earn extra income. Her husband, Chin Cheang, 36, is both a fisherman and a construction worker. This couple, married for years, is blessed with four teenage children, one of whom is employed while the other three are still dependent on their parents. Because their house is old and damaged, Phoeung Y. is requesting a loan of $800 loan to repair it.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem M. is 46 years old and married to Chor Nak, 47, a former construction worker. They live in Reusey Keo commune, in the capital of Phnom Penh. They have five teenage children, two of whom are married and have their own homes, and three of whom are still dependent on their income.
Nem M. is a fresh fish seller. Recently, her husband has faced difficulties attracting customers for his motorcycle services, and his income is declining due to his existing motorcycle breaking down frequently. Therefore, Nem M. is requesting a loan to replace her husband’s broken motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: To replace her husband’s broken taxi motorcycle

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S., a longtime businesswoman who earns a living by selling fish in the busy local market, resides in Reusey Keo commune, located in Phnom Penh. She buys the fish in bulk from her wholesale supplier and typically earns $5 a day which helps her to buy food for her family. Sen S. is a divorced mother who has given birth to five children, three married and two single. Two of her sons are employed. Sen S. is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a used vehicle which she will use to pick up her fish and transport them to the market.

loans.use: To buy a used vehicle

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang N. is 44 years old and married to Soam Sitha, 46, a driver for the foreign ministry. The couple has been married for many years and is blessed with three children, two of whom are students and the other of whom is married.
Neang N. owns a medium-size restaurant inside a market, where she sells Chinese noodles and soft drinks. She starts her business in the morning and sells to customers who come to the market to buy ingredients for their daily cooking. Fresh fish is commanding its lowest price in this coming season, so Neang N. thinks that it is the time to generate additional income. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase a large amount of fish to turn into fish paste to sell at a profit.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of fish to make fish paste

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Ana Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lideresas II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín,  Es Casada, tiene 58 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, todos ya independiente.

Anita, como le dicen D. cariño, lleva 25 años dedicándose a la confección D. vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo D. actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller D. costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donD. diariamente atienD. a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. En la actualidad, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes granD. y D. variados colores, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel belongs to the Las Lideresas II Communal bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 58, married, and has three independent children. Anita, as she is affectionately called, has been making clothing for 25 year. Having knowledge about this type of activity, she had no doubts about setting up her own clothes making shop, which is located in her own house in a very well equipped area. She waits on her steady customers daily. They know her, and they need her service. She works on orders that her customers make in advance. She now feels very happy and proud of what she has achieved. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy meters of different types and colors of fabric, instruments that she uses like scissors, large spools of different colors of thread, sewing and machine needles, pins, and buttons. She now feels like a fulfilled woman with the desire to achieve and make her other dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping lot of women who want to grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: Audemia

texts.es:
La señora Audemia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dorcas de San Juan II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Audemia, lleva poco tiempo dedicándose a la venta  de mantequilla maní, ya que gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio, para generar ingresos propios y así aportar en los gastos del hogar. Se inicio con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, poco a poco fue vendiendo mas y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará semanalmente kilos de mami.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Audemia belongs to the “Las Dorcas de San Juan II” Communal Bank district of Banda de Shilcayo, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. She lives with her partner, is 33 years old and is a mother of 4 children, 3 still depend on her.

Audemia has been selling peanut butter for a short time, and thanks to her spirit and enterprising energy, she has she decided to start her own business to have her own income and to help in the household expenses. She began with her first loan of S/. 300.00 and little by little she sold more and became very well known by her customers. With this loan of S/. 800.00 she will buy weekly kilograms of peanuts.

She is very satisfied with the work that she does and believes that the sacrifice is worth it so that she can see her dreams and goals come true that she has planned in her life. In the same way she is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva's field partner) for supporting her and other women who wish to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kilograms of peanuts.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
La señora Janet, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Solidarias II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.

Siendo la madera un insumo importante para la confección de muebles no vio mejor oportunidad que dedicarse a la compra venta de maderas al por mayor y menor, negocio que lo desarrolla en su mismo hogar con el apoyo de su esposo, atendiendo pedidos de las carpinterías y ebanisterías mas importante de la ciudad y la región, entre sus clientes es muy reconocida por la calidad de las maderas que vende y por el buen trato que los brinda.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará   cuartones de madera como tornillo, cedro, caoba, ishpingo entre variedades que son muy apreciadas para la confección de muebles de sala, comedor, cocina, oficinas.    

Janet, es una mujer muy emprendedora y perseverante, cualidades que sirven de ejemplo para otras mujeres que como ella quiere salir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por contribuir con sus sueños y metas que tiene.
texts.en:
Ms. Janet, belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Solidarias II”, in the Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, in the San Martín State. She lives with her partner, is 30 years old, and a mother of one son, who is still dependent on her. Recognizing that wood is an important part of furniture manufacturing, she saw a great opportunity in selling wood furniture wholesale and retail. She handles the business in her own home with the support of her husband, handling requests from the most important carpenters and cabinet-makers in the region who are among her clients. She is highly recognized for the quality of the woods she sells and for the good work that has resulted from her efforts. With the loan of 1,500.00 soles, she will buy planks of wood such as cedar and mahogony, as well as purchase screws and other woods that are among the most precious woods for making living room, dining room, kitchen and office furniture. Janet, is a very hard- working business woman, qualities that make her an example to other women like her who want to move forward in their lives. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement, for contributing to the dreams and goals she has set for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase planks of wood

loans.name: Kelly Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Kelly Ruth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas de la Molina II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y es madre de 02  hijos, que aun están a cargo de ella y estudian. 

La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza le motivó a implementar su propio negocio de Servicio de Internet, se inicio con  S/. 800.00 y día a día fue ganando clientela dado el buen trato que les brinda y el precio cómodo en la hora de servicio de Internet. Actualmente continúa con este negocio pero ya ampliando más cabinas y considerando la demanda que tiene entre sus clientes que generalmente son adolescentes y vecinos del barrio donde vive. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará computadoras, para implementarlo mas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en cables,  para mejorar su cableado de red con canaletas, para dar un buen servicio y seguridad.

Kelly Ruth, manifiesta que trabaja con mucho optimismo, agradeciendo la oportunidad de contar con préstamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Kelly Ruth belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Brisas de la Molina II”, in the Banda district of Shilcayo, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is in a common-law union, she is 29 years old and a mother of 2 children, who are still dependent upon her and studying.

The strength and perseverance that are so characteristic of her motivated her to start her own Internet Service business. She began with S/. 800.00 and day by day she attracted her clientele, given the good treatment and affordable price per hour of Internet service she provides. Nowadays she continues with this business, but has increased the number of booths because of the demand she has among her clients, who generally are teenagers and live in her neighbourhood.

With this loan of S/. 1,500.00 she will purchase computers to further expand her business. Part of the money will also be invested in cables, to improve her network wiring with cable racks, in order to provide a good service and safety.

Kelly Ruth says that she works with a lot of optimism, and she is grateful for the opportunity of having loans available that help her grow both as a woman and a small entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of computer accesories

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun N., 49, has been selling dried fish in market for years. She is married with a teenage child who attends school. Her husband operates a trailer-motor taxi. Bun N. wants to increase her current income by also selling plastic items, but she doesn’t have money to purchase inventory. She is therefore applying for a loan to be used as the needed capital.

Bun N. was not available when the photo taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase plastic goods for resale.

loans.name: Liz Vani

texts.es:
La señora Liz Vani, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Solidarias II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 24 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Liz Vani, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 06 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará mas bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Liz Vani, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Ms. Liz Vani belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Solidarias II”, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is in a common-law marriage, she is 24 years old and has one son, still dependent upon her.

Liz Vani is a woman that likes to work so she decided to start her own soft drink business, located in her own home, in very well equipped premises. She runs her business herself, without a timetable or a boss. She tells us she started with S/. 300.00 and began by purchasing six packages of soda pops. She saw things were going very well and she needed more soda pops, so little by little she invested more. Nowadays she continues the business and she is already well known among her clients.

With this S/. 2,500.00 loan she will purchase more drinks, such as sodas in different flavours, sizes and brand names, as well as mineral water, both still and sparkling.

Liz Vani has many goals and feels motivated to make her plans come true. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her repayment terms and means to continue this way.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Luz Angélica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II” Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 43 años, 01 hijo pequeño que aun depende de ella.

Luz Angélica, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Luz Angélica, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Luz Angélica belongs to the “Las Estrellitas II” communal bank, located in Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 43 years old, separated, and has one small child who still depends on her.

Luz Angélica is a hard-working and competitive woman, and so she decided to start her own soft drink sales business. She runs the business from her home, without a boss or a schedule. She started out with an investment of only 300 soles (about $100 US), which bought 5 cases of soft drinks. She saw that the business was going well, so she invested more little by little. Today, she continues the same business, and is well known by her neighbors, family, and friends.

With this loan of 1300 soles, she will buy more drinks, such as different flavors, sizes, and brands of soft drinks, as well as mineral water with and without carbonation.

Luz Angélica has many goals ahead and feels very motivated to make her dreams a reality. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement organization for helping her when she needed it the most. She is responsible with her loan payments and will continue to be in the future.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Magali Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Magali, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Solidarias II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 31 años, es madre de 03 hijos, en etapa escolar y que aún dependen de ella.

Se inicio en la venta de pescado fresco, hace 10 años atrás, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un primer capital de S/. 200.00 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad de  especies.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará pescado seco en kilos tanto los que produce la región como los de la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. 

Ella nos manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magali is a member of the communal bank “Las Solidarias II.” This bank is located in the Tarapoto district, in the province of San Martin, in the Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 31 years old, and is the mother of three dependent, school-age children. She began selling fresh fish ten years ago to help her family with the bills. She started out with 200 soles of working capital that turned out to be a good investment because today she is still in the same business, but with greater quantities and varieties of fish. With the loan of 1,200.00 soles, she will buy kilos of dried fish, fish that are produced in the region as well as those from the coast like: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey to keep her business stocked and satisfy the demands of her customers. Mrs. Magali expresses her satisfaction at being part of a women’s group for so many years, a group that has helped her get through a difficult period in her life. She now has the strength to confront difficulties with more strength.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fish.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Exito Group

texts.es:
La señora Dolivethi tiene un año y cuatro meses formando parte del grupo “PROSPERIDAD Y ÉXITO”  donD. tiene el cargo D. presidenta. La señora vive en la Urb. Rivera D. chillón una zona nueva y prospera, ella nos cuenta que al inicio  era una zona donD. no había muchos negocios es así que es una D. la primeras en poner el negocio D. cabinas D. Internet; pues en aquel lugar no se contaba con ese servicio siendo la única capto muchos clientes posteriormente a pesar que  le salio competencia, ella pudo salir adelante por su empeño, dedicación y su buen trato hizo D. que sus clientes siempre acudan a su negocio, por otro lado también se esta iniciando en el negocio D. minimarket que recién a formado en sociedad. 
Lo que mas le fascina es el rubro D. alimentos ya que  considera que es su especialidad,  ella prepara comidas para eventos y actividades por lo que es conocida en ese rubro y tiene muchos contratos; lo que le gustaría en el futuro es formalizarse y crear una marca y patente. Por parte D. EDAPROSPO ella recibe mucho apoyo y siempre recuerda cuando caminando por el mercado encontró un afiche tirado en el suelo que hablaba sobre los prestamos que EDAPROSPO otorgaba y así deciD. formar su grupo con amigas del barrio, considera que con los prestamos que recibió mejoro su negocio ya que con su ganancia pudo comprar vitrinas y enceres para mejorarlo. Su actual préstamo lo usara para comprar mercadería para su minimarket, sabe que se acerca las fiestas naviD.ñas y habrá mucha venta. 


*En la foto al lado derecho aparecen como invitadas 2 socias pasivas la Sra dolivethy esta D. pie es la cuarta D. la derecha.
texts.en:
For one year and four months, Dolivethi has been a member of the “PROSPERIDAD Y ÉXITO” [Prosperity and Success] group, for which she holds the post of president. She lives in the Rivera neighborhood of Chillón, a new and prosperous area. She tells us that at first there were few businesses in the area, and she was one of the first to open an Internet café. Since that service had not previously existed in the neighborhood, and her business was the only one, she attracted many customers. Later, even though competition arose, she was able to maintain her success through hard work, dedication and excellent service that kept customers coming back to her business. At the same time, she also ventured into the minimarket business and has recently started a company. What fascinates her most is the field of food service, which she considers her specialty. She prepares food for events and activities; she is well-known in this field and receives many contracts. In the future, she would like to formalize this business and create a brand and patent. She receives much support from EDAPROSPO; she will always remember the time when she was walking through the market and found a poster that had been tossed on the ground which talked about the loans offered by EDAPROSPO, and she decided to form her group with friends from the neighborhood. She believes that the loans she has received have helped her improve her business, since with the profits she was able to purchase display cases and equipment to enhance it. She will use the current loan to buy merchandise for her minimarket; she knows that the Christmas holidays are approaching and the sales volume will be high. *In the photo, on the right-hand siD., two passive partners appear as guests; Dolivethy is standing up and is the fourth from the right.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her minimarket

loans.name: Miranda

texts.es:
La señora Miranda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas de la Molina II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 25 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.

Miranda, lleva 08 meses dedicándose a la venta  de aguajes ya que gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio, para generar ingresos propios y así aportar en los gastos del hogar. Se inicio con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, poco a poco fue vendiendo mas y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará semanalmente 15 sacos de aguajes.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Miranda is a member of the communal bank “Las Brisas de la Molina II.” The bank is located in the Banda de Shilcayo district, of the San Martin province, in the department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 25 years old, and the mother of a dependent son. Miranda has been selling a small round fruit called “aguaje” for eight months. She is an energetic and enterprising woman who decided to start her own business, to generate her own income, so she could contribute to the household expenses. She began with a loan of 300.00 soles and bit-by-bit began to sell more as she got to know her customers. She will buy 15 sacks of “aguajes” each week with this loan of 500.00 soles. Miranda is satisfied with her work. She believes that it is worth the effort in order to reach the dreams and goals she has laid out for her life. She is also grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for giving her, and other women, the opportunity to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of aguajes

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra M. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old and is married with four adult-aged children. Alejandra is a farmer who grows corn for sale. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2008, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Alejandra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alejandra is requesting a second loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the additional revenues generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
