GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops

loans.name: El Nuevo Amanecer De Ventanilla Group

texts.es:
Cuando era muy pequeña la señora Rosa siempre vio a su padre como criaba y cuidaba sus cerdos en la pequeña granja que tenia, con ese trabajo su padre pudo sustentar a su familia ella siempre lo ayudo en ese oficio, al transcurrir el tiempo ya casada a ella le nace la idea D. dedicarse a ese negocio porque heredo el amor por los animales que su padre le enseño. La señora con el tiempo se compro un terreno en un lugar adecuado para la crianza empezó con dos cerditos no muy finos le fue tan bien que empezaron aumentar y tuvo que adecuar sus corrales. 
Con los prestamos D. EDAPROSPO ella ha logrado muchas cosas por ejemplo mejorar la raza D. sus animales y ambientar los corrales, siente que cada día le va mejor y su granja ha crecido mucho lo cual la hace feliz, también se siente contenta saber que su trabajo no ha sido en vano porque sus hijos están siguiendo sus pasos, en el futuro ella quiere construir con material noble todo sus corrales para la comodidad y seguridad D. los mismos ya que actualmente es D. aboD. con madera y no tiene la seguridad que requiere, con el tiempo modernizara su granja para poder estar a la par con otros negociantes que se dedican al mismo rubro. Por otro lado la señora Rosa también trabaja en la Municipalidad D. Ventanilla en el área D. reforestación y forma parte del comedor D. su zona es así como conoció a EDAPROSPO y se animo a formar el grupo “El nuevo amanecer D. ventanilla” con las socias. Este préstamo le servirá D. mucho porque lo usara para mejorar  el comedero y bebedero D. los cerdos ya que con el tiempo se han deteriorado la señora se siente feliz porque trabaja con toda su familia y se apoyan unos a otros. 

*la Sra Rosa es la cuarta D. la derecha
texts.en:
When she was very small, Rosa always watched her father care for his pigs on his small farm. With this work, her father was able to support the family. Rosa would help him with his work. Later in life, Rosa, now married, decided to go into this business herself, as she had inherited the love for the animals from her father.

Rosa bought some land adequate for raising pigs and began with two small and not very good pigs. Her business began to grow and she had to enlarge her enclosures.

With loans from EDAPROSPO, she has maD. many improvements, such as improving the breeds of the animals and arranging the enclosures. The farm is growing and getting better every day, which makes her happy. She also is happy that her children are following in her footsteps. In the future, she plans to reconstruct all the enclosures with good materials, as they are now maD. of wood and adobe and are not secure. With time, she will modernize the farm to be on a par with others in the same business.

AsiD. from the farm, Rosa also works for the city of Ventanilla in the department of reforestation and also at a dining room in her neighborhood. This is how she came to know of EDAPROSPO and was motivated to form the “El Nuevo Amanecer D. Ventanilla” [“The New Dawn of Ventanilla”] loan group with the other members.

This loan will be used to improve the food and water troughs for the pigs, as they have deteriorated over time. Rosa feels happy because she works with her whole family, and they support one another.

In the picture, Rosa is the fourth from the right.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve water and food troughs on her farm

loans.name: Nchampi

texts.en:
Nchampi L. is a 49-year-old single lady with three children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables along one of the streets in Naivasha for the last two years.

This is Nchampi’s first loan from KADET. She has never borrowed from any micro finance institution before. she learned about KADET through a friend who is already a client.

With this loan, Nchampi plans to rent a shop for her grocery. This will enable her to make more sales and hence more income. She aspires to be a vegetable supplier to big hotels in Naivasha town and the outskirts.




About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living

loans.use: To rent a shop for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda C. is from the village of Mallig. She is 59 years old. Erlinda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda raises pigs for sale. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase pig feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Usukhbayar

texts.en:
P. Usukhbayar is 40 years old and lives with his wife, son and daughter in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger." Usukhbayar operates a bicycle repair shop and car wash in his town, while his wife manages a grocery business. Usukhbayar started his businesses in 2003 after receiving a loan of 300,000 tugrugs (~$210 US) from Xacbank, one of Kiva's partners in Mongolia. He has worked hard and today is well established in the local business community. Today, his working capital exceeds 5,800,000 tugrugs (~$4,080 US). He says, "I am trying to save money to support my children's future." Usukhbayar is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 tugrug (~$1,050 US) to purchase inventory for his grocery shop.


About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase shop inventory

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites B. is from the village of Siempre Viva Sur, Mallig, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Marites is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marites bakes and sells bread in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment. Marites is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baking ingredients and some equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients and equipment

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is from the city of Capatan Tuguegarao City. She is 49 years old. Victoria is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria provides manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Victoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Victoria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena R. is from the city of Capatan Tuguegarao City. She is 49 years old. Rowena is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Rowena runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rowena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

To make a living, Cristina owns & operates a business planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to have additional capital to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Motorcycle transport is the primary source of income for Nida and her husband in the village of Barangay Capatan Tuguegarao, City. Aside from her transport business, Nida is also engaged in selling fruits and vegetables as an additional source of income. Carlos, her husband, is the one who operates their motorcycle business to earn an income for their daily basic needs.
For the continuous development of their transport business, Nida is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 from KIVA lenders. She hopes that her loan will again be approved to enable her to repair her motorcycle to keep it working. She will also use some of the loan for her vending business.

The couple is working double time for the welfare of their children. They hope that their children will finish their college degrees.

loans.use: To maintain her husband's vehicle

texts.en:

To make a living, Eulita owns & operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Eulita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Eulita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials for her tailoring business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eulita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily M. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She is 29 years old.  Emily is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the primary source of income for the business comes from selling charcoal in the local community.  Emily has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.  

In 2008, Emily joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emily is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business.  This loan will her second loan from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
E. Ariunaa is 40 years old and lives with her two children in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. She and her two children live together in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". Both of her children are college students. Ariunaa operates a shoe making business in her town. She specializes in making a variety of traditional Mongolian shoes such as "buriads" and "mongols". Her business is especially busy during national holidays, celebrations and the wedding season. 

Ariunaa started her business in 2007 after her husband was killed in a car accident the previous year. She has worked hard to grow her business over the last two years but it has been difficult at times to lead a normal life. As her business is the only source of income for her family, she is focused on improving her skills as a shoemaker and expanding her business. The most important thing to her is being able to provide for her childrens' education. She says, "education is very important in one's life and I want my children to become important people who will improve our society". 

Ariunaa has many plans for the future and hopes to soon purchase a more sophisticated sewing machine to make her business more efficient. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan to purchase leather, glue, thread, and other necessary materials for her business.


About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase leather, glue, and thread

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es: Roxana Elizabeth A. D. C. D. 29 años D. edad, resiD. en Colón departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija D. cuatro años D. edad. Roxana posee una venta D. verduras en el mercado D. Ciudad Arce, lo posee desD. hace cinco años, justo el tiempo que tiene D. vivir junto a su esposo. DesD. hace cuatro años Roxana se siente más comprometida por mejorar su negocio, ya que esta es la edad D. su hija, el motor que la hace seguir adelante cada día. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar más verduras, ya que desea aumentar las ventas D. su negocio, puesto que Roxana es una mujer que se proyecta a futuro y sabe que debe mejorar su fuente D. ingresos para brindarle una vida mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Roxana Elizabeth A. D. C. is 29 years old and lives in the Colón department of La Libertad with her husband and four-year-old daughter. Roxana has a vegetable stall in the Ciudad Arce market. She has had this stall for five years - since she and her husband began living together. For the last four years, Roxana has felt more committed to improving her business, because since then her daughter has been the driving force giving her the strength to keep going every day. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more vegetables as she wants to increase her sales. Roxana is a forward-thinking woman who knows that she must improve her source of income to proviD. a better life for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of vegetables

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en:
B. Sukhbaatar is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in Khovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His two older daughters currently attend a local secondary school and his youngest is too young to go to school. 

Sukhbaatar operates a meat and livestock trading business at the local town market with the help of his wife. He started his business in 1997 and has built a successful operation over the years. His business has provided financial security for his family and has enabled him to purchase a car. Sukhbaatar hopes to continue his success in the future and grow his business further. He is requesting a 1,800,000 tugrugs (~1266 USD) loan to purchase meat to sell in his business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel A. A. de 46 años de edad, reside en  Ciudad Arce junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como vigilante de seguridad privada, y junto a sus dos hijos.
Ella posee una venta de ropa usada la cual la comercializa de manera ambulante por las calles de Ciudad Arce. María solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar más ropa, ya que en esta temporada de fin de año ella logra incrementar sus ventas, María trabaja muy duro y es por esto que es una persona muy respetada y querida por sus vecinos, los cuales dan muy buenas referencias de ella.
texts.en:
María Isabel A. A. is 46 years old. She lives in the city of Arce together with her husband, who works as a private security guard, and their two sons. María sells used clothes. She travels the streets of Arce to sell them. She is asking for a loan so she can buy more clothes since in this year-end season she has increased sales. María works very hard, so she is well-respected and loved by her neighbors, all of whom give her good references.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia G. B. de 51 años de edad, vive en Ciudad Arce junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como conductor de un pick up. Rosa posee un comedor en el cual elabora comida típica salvadoreña como así también desayunos y almuerzos. Ela solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder comprar, carne, pollo, maíz y bebidas para su negocio, debido a que su clientela ha crecido ella espera poderles brindas un menú más amplio y así poder atenderlos mejor. Rosa es muy responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, la cual se esfuerza mucho por mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia G. B. is 51 years old. She lives in the city of Arce with her husband, who works as a pick-up truck driver. Rosa has a restaurant where she serves typical Salvadorean food, including breakfast and lunch. She is asking for a loan because she wants to be able to buy meat, chicken, corn, and drinks for her business since her clientele has increased. She hopes to be able to offer them a more extensive menu and therefore serve them better. Rosa is very responsible and dedicated to her work. She works hard to improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying perishable items

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jiguusen

texts.en:
Jiguusen B. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian tent called a "ger". Her husband works as a fireman, her son is a university student and her daughter attends secondary school. 

Jiguusen operates a grocery trading business out of a rented stall at a local market in her town. She started her business in 2007 after previously working as a salesperson at a local store. Jiguusen has made great progress with her new business over the past two years and has built good relationships with her many customers and suppliers. She has a very positive outlook for her business and treats her customers with respect. 

Today, her working capital exceeds 800,000 tugrugs (~$560). Jiguusen has many plans for the future and hopes to purchase a shipping container to operate her business out of.  Growing her business is very important to her .  "I want my children to get a good education," says Jiguusen.  She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~$700) loan to purchase candies, biscuits, sugar and other products for her business.
-------------------------

loans.name: Mandah

texts.en:
G. Mandakh is 53 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Khovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His oldest daughter currently operates a shoe-making business, his two youngest daughters are secondary school students, and his only son is two years old.

Mandakh operates a second-hand clothes business in his town. He purchases used clothing from Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's largest city and capital, and transports it back to his province to sell. Mandakh started his business in 2004 and has built a stable operation over the years. He is a very open-minded and hardworking person and has used his business to provide a good life for his family.

Mandakh hopes to continue his success and plans to expand his business in the near future. He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase second-hand clothes for his business. loans.name: Juan Celestino

texts.es: Juan Celestino R. de 38 años, reside en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a ser ama de hogar. Juan se dedica a hacer viajes a personas particulares en la zona de Atiquizaya, trabajo del cual junto a su esposa subsisten desde hacer un par de años. Es por esto que Juan solícita un préstamo y de esta manera poder comprar amortiguadores para su automóvil, Juan es una persona muy emprendedora que sabe apreciar su trabajo y es por esto que desea invertir en su automóvil y de esta manera cuidarlo, ya que es el que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Juan Celestino R. is 38 years old. He lives in Atiquizaya in the department of Ahuachapán. He lives together with his wife, who takes care of their home. Juan works driving private individuals in the zone of Atiquizaya. With this work, he has supported him and his wife for the past few years. He is asking for a loan so he can buy shock absorbers for his car. Juan is a very entrepreneurial person who knows how to appreciate his job. For this reason, he wants to invest in his care and take care of it, because his car is what allows him to support his household.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shock absorbers

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador A. L. de 49 años de edad, reside en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán, junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Salvador posee una panadería y una tienda  de productos perecederos, negocios en los cuales trabaja junto a su esposa. Salvador es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador el cual según sus vecinos es muy amable y de muy buenos valores. El solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar granos básicos y otros productos perecederos para la tienda, así también desea comprar materia prima para la elaboración del pan. Debido a que Salvador cuenta con una familia muy extensa, él posee el deseo de poder ampliar sus negocios y así contar con la capacidad de brindarles todo lo necesario a sus cuatro hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Salvador A. L. is 49 years old. He lives in Atiquizaya in the department of Ahuachapán together with his wife and four young children. All his children are in school. Salvador has a bakery and a store where he sells perishable food items. He works these businesses together with his wife. Salvador is a very happy and hard-working man. According to his neighbors, he is very nice and has very good values. He is asking for a loan so that he can buy basic grains and other perishable items for his store. He also wants to buy ingredients to make bread. Because Salvador has a large family, he hopes to be able to grow his businesses that way he can provide his wife and four children with everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying perishable items and ingredients for bread-making

loans.name: María Hilda

texts.es: María Hilda R. D. P. D. 59 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Delgado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Comparte su hogar junto a su esposo, hijos y nietos. María posee una tienda y una librería en su propia casa, y es a través D. dicho negocio, la cual le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que a pesar que sus hijos son mayores, deben velar por sus propias necesidades. María solícita un préstamo a través del cual ella pueda comprar productos perecederos, ya que en la actualidad cuenta con pocos productos para la tienda, así mismo desea poder surtir la librería y poder aprovechar el inicio a clases, el cual será a principios del próximo año y es por esto que María desea tener su negocio muy equipado.
texts.en:
María Hilda R. D. P., 59, lives in Delgado city in the San Salvador department. She shares her home with her husband, children, and grandchildren. María has a store and a bookstore in her own house. Through these businesses she helps her husband with the household expenses. In spite of the fact that her children are grown, they should watch out for their own needs. María is asking for a loan to be able to buy perishable products. She currently has few products in her store. She also wishes to be able to stock the bookstore and take advantage of the start up of classes. They will start at the beginning of next year, and María wants her store to be well equipped.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her bookstore and perishable products for her store

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: But

texts.en: But S., a 38-year-old mother of six children, all teenagers and attending school, generates her daily income by selling stone with her husband. Purchasing large stone blocks from people who live near the mountains, they break down and carve them into small pieces, finally selling the pieces to people who need them to build their houses or to cover the street. This stone-selling business is the family's main source of income, and But S. is looking for her second loan in the amount of $1100 to purchase more stone blocks.

loans.use: To purchase more stone for resale

Rubetes has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, y así mismo hace pupusas las cuales las venD. en el mismo lugar. Milagro es una persona muy alegre, la cual disfruta D. la compañía D. las personas, ya que en su caso vive sola y es la única que vela por su propio bienestar y sustento. 57-year old Milagro G. D. Z. lives in Ahuachapán department. She runs a shop selling perishable goods, and also makes pupusas (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) which she sells in her store. Milagro is a lively person who enjoys the company of other people. As she lives alone, she is responsible for her own wellbeing and support. For this reason she is asking for a loan to buy more stock for her store which will allow her to earn more money and improve her current financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy ingredients to make tortillas and pupusas

loans.name: Namjilmaa

texts.en:
J. Namjilmaa is 57 years old and lives with her three children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest daughter lives and works outside of Mongolia, her oldest son helps run the family business and her youngest is a secondary school student.

Namjilmaa operates a consumer goods trading business in her town. She started her business in 2005 with $35 working capital. Since starting her business she has gained much experience as a businesswoman and has built a stable customer base. She attributes her business success to her good accounting skills.

Namjilmaa hopes to continue her success in the future and says, "All I want is to grow my business so I can improve my family's quality of life." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase supplies for her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009.
